title: Feature requesl: List of my books in series from series menu
body:
Hi,
Some series of books contain more than one author and it would be nice to be able to show all the books of the series from the menu when sorting first the author and then the series.
Thank you and I apologize for my weak English.

title: Published date GMT but displayed in locale
label: [Label(name="Defect")]
body: SOme users have reported that the publication date is shown as one day early in view mode; this could be a result of date conversion to locale.

title: Error "Can't Connect . . . " After Scanning ISBN Bar Code
body:
I hope this is in the right place; please move it if not.

After a long hiatus for unrelated reasons, I'm back to Book Catalogue again. I downloaded the latest version (I don't remember which version I had been using before my phone needed a factory reset) and imported my book database from SD card. I really like the program, but I'm experiencing a problem when I scan ISBN bar codes. The scan is successful, but immediately afterward, I get the message:

"_Sorry Can't connect to get the latest prices and offers right now. we're sorry for the inconvenience_"

Clicking the OK button in the error window takes me back to the main book list, not the book entry. The just-scanned book was correctly entered.

I assume this issue is caused by some problem in connecting to Amazon or whoever.  I searched for settings related to this, but can't seem to find any (are there any?). I also read through the Wiki and the rest of this project to no avail. I don't recall ever seeing this error before.

**More Details:**
- Samsung Galaxy SII Skyrocket i727 (AT&T version) 
- Consumer Cellular (AT&T network, mostly)
- Android 4.1.2
- BookCatalogue 5.2.2
- All of this was done while on WiFi and the app doesn't otherwise complain about connectivity.
- I successfully connected to GoodReads and LibraryThing.

I hope someone can help me get past this.

Thanks,

Jack

title: [Feature request] Show list of found books
body:
If I search for a book to add it to a shelve by Author/Title, than alway one random book gets added - which is in 99% the wrong one.

Example:
Search for the Author "Sebastian Fitzek" (option: search internet). He has written 10 or more books. One of this 10 gets added automatically and I'm not able to choose the right one. The chance is very bad to get the book I searched for.

Request:
Please add a chooseable list of the found titles (in best case with author, title and cover) to pick the book manually by the user.

title: Order of Fields not Tab-Key friendly
body:
Hi,
I started using your app. And to catalogue my books faster I am using my bluetooth keyboard instead of the android onscreen keyboard.
That is working ok-ish. But the order of fields are not in a good order.
The add button is before the Field of Author in the tab-order. So you enter the author "shift+tab" -> "enter" to add -> "tab tab tab" -> "enter" to save".
Also with the series field its: number <- add <- series name -> list -> cancel -> save.
So the key sequence is "series name" -> 2x "shift+tab" -> "number"-> "tab" -> "enter" to add -> "tab tab tab tab" -> "enter" to save
The order should be imho: series name -> number -> add -> list -> cancel -> save.
Thanks

title: Thumbnails using up all of my Internal storage, how to move to SD Card?
body:
I have the same issue with the books I've been buying since I first purchased your most excellent program not long after it came out. It works perfectly and does everything I need, with one potentially fatal flaw I think I'm getting ready to experience. Just the books I have on my internal drive take up a huge amount of space, while I have a 250GB SD card sitting there not close to full. However, Im finally getting ready to add my entire library of roughly 2000 books to your app, and if what I have in the database now is using up such a large amount of internal memory, adding 2000 more books to it will likely cause my phone to burst into flames! :-) There's GOT to be some way to store at least the thumbnails, if not the entire program on the SD card. If not, though your program is without a doubt the best book database out there, I may be forced to see if I can find a second-rate substitute before I start this daunting project. I REALLY don't want to do that, since again I love what you've done, but I simply won't have enough internal memory to store the incoming thumbnails.

I'm hoping to start this project in a couple of weeks or less, so some timely help would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks again for the great App, and I'm sure hoping your have a solution.

All the best, Jay...

title: Synchronization with GoodReads doesn't work?
body:
Hi,

I have scanned 375 books into BC. I sent them to GR, a lot of them made it through, but 100+ did not, all of them foreign books that apparently GR cannot find the ISBN for. This is not the issue, I am having problems synchronizing the other way.

I had 239 books in GR after that import. I added 17 Kindle books for a total of 256. I then try the "Synchronize with GR" and "Import everything from GR" commands. The background tasks seem to end successfully, but no books are added to BC, I still have 375 books in BC. 

Is this normal?

title: eBooks
body:
Hi,

I am glad I have found this app. About half my books are in Russian and Book-Catalogue is the only app that can look up those ISBNs. So, 371 scans and an exhausting day later, all my paper books are catalogued. Which still leaves me with a few dozen ebooks. These past years I've been almost exclusively reading books from Amazon and litres.ru on my Kindle. Is there a trick to quickly scan those? I didn't find anything in the app, and the only thing I can think of is manually entering all the ISBNs, which sounds even more exhausting than scanning and reorganizing all those paper books. :)

PS: I'm not sure this qualifies as an issue. Is there a forum to discuss Book Catalogue features, tricks and stuff?

title: Audio Books
body: When I search for books to add by author and title, it only returns paperbook info.  While I can choose the audiobook option from a dropdown, it still leaves pages instead of running time info which is what I want.  I do I get audiobook info in the search results to choose from.  I very rarely know an ISBN.

title: Bulk edit
body: I would like the option of bulk editing, for language or publisher for example. Is this possible?

title: Original title
body: Is there a way to add the original title of a translated book?

title: Unable to export database
body:
I have been running Book Catalogue on a Sony Xperia Z5 for some time but was unable to backup to SD card. I have now changed my phone to a Samsung S8 and want to transfer the database to the new phone but am struggling. If I select Admin\Backup to Archive on the Z5, it opens in /storage/sdcard0/bookCatalogue. If I select Save\All Books I get the error message saying 'Backup Failed'. If I try again but this time instead of the default path I select the 'Parent' button twice, the path changes to '/' but there are no selectable locations below.

If I carry out the same procedure on the S8 the default path is /sdcard/bookCatalogue and I am able to backup the database successfully. If I select the Parent button twice I am able to select the sdcard in the window below. Therefore it looks like Book Catalogue on the Z5 can't access the SD card while plenty of other apps are able to. I have used the same SD card in both phones and have tried two others with a similar lack of success. The Storage permission is enabled on both phones for Book Catalogue.

I have tried to copy the whole Book Catalogue directory over to the S8 but it just starts as a blank database. I'm sure I'm missing something very simple here and I apologise for the length of the post but would appreciate some help as I have over 1,000 books in my database.

Many thanks,
Mac.

title: ability to sync subset of books with goodreads
body: All shelves on goodreads are public; it would be nice if there was a way to exclude particular books from being synced to goodreads.

title: Thumbnail move to external card
body: I've a 174Mb worth of thumbnails sitting on my internal memory. Please for my sanity is there a way to move them to an external card?

title: Structural suggestion to support WORK rather than books
body:
Hello,

(I will be able to translate in English if necessary)

Very very good application but a major structural problem, and some suggestions for significant improvement.
FYI, I have 4000 titles of works + 5000 BDs ... and the habit of management tools!

1- Structure: The main need is to identify a WORK, not the title of the book, the book, the paper object or the digital file containing this work. This makes it possible to know if one has it to read it, to lend it, to buy it ... even if it is within a paper or digital object with different title.
However, the title of the work is not necessarily the title of the book: collection of short stories (eg S. King), Anthology (eg French poetry), integral works (eg "All Sherlock Holmes") , collection (ex: library of the Pleiade Gallimard).

For this, I propose the following development:
- instead of "Anthology", create a field "Title of the work". We can not actually list the titles of your anthology, or even do a search (the words of the titles in the anthology are not recognized by your search engine).
Base your main database on this Work field and not Work field (= "Title" field of your current base).
- place this new field after the title of the work, with a default copy of the title of the work (most common case = Identical title for work and work).
- to allow the seizure of several works under the same title of work (cf the principle of the multiple authors), possibly with multiple authors (also possible to consider the title of the work like a simple field informant, like the other metadata, l work, which can be in several different works: a fairy tale of Grimm can be in the integral of Grimm and also in a collection of tales of the world).
- provide a field specifying the status of the work within the book: Roman, short story, story, poem, preface, comment (incremental list). Preface and commentary are sometimes real works when the authors are famous: Translation of Poe by Baudelaire ...
- allow sorting by the Work, as with other fields (it should be even the main entrance to the base!).
=> this does not change anything for the input by isbn which gives the work, but the metadata of this work can be duplicated on several works.

2- Moreover, another difficulty of your current base is that it does not distinguish the Series (ex: "Human Comedy" of Balzac) from the Publishing Collection (ex: "Library of the Pleiade", Black River, Folio, Pocket Book). Two different fields would be more relevant than mixing the two by entering them in multiple sets in the Series field.

3- Storage: rather than Library (= Rays, why 2 different names?) And Location, not very explicit, present this:

A- either in clear hierarchical fields (allows filter and sort on each):
- Library, to distinguish the collection of Mr. and Mrs. for example or 2 different houses (= my case)
- Room / Furniture / Shelf / Location (ex: front / back when multiple rows on the same shelf)

B- either (- powerful) with a powerful search (filters function not present in your tool ??? Filter "Location" field contains "et2" and "rg4") on a single "Location" field where you enter in code this last in standard personal format. "Lieu_Piece_Meuble_Étagère_Emplacement".
 
Other improvements:

4- create the Filter function on all fields, with multiple titles and filter backup. See your Sort function.

5- add 5 customizable free fields:
- 1 numeric field (eg if each book is tagged with a unique personal code)
- 1 incremental list field (eg if you want to add a "Book status" field)
- 1 free text field (eg to isolate notes always of the same nature: state of the book, personal notes of reading ...)
- 1 yes / no field (eg to help when updating / completing the cards after a quick entry: "completed form" Yes / No)
- 1 Date field (eg "Sheet updated to" Date).

Hoping that these constructive suggestions I hope will help you make your application my Grail!

I am willing to collaborate to refine these suggestions and test them.

Regards,
LUCM

title: Improve user interface
body: Despite the app being very useful, I think its design is a bit outdated compared to today's Android standards. Because of that, I thought about implementing a Material Design like visual, so I'd like to know if you guys have an opinion about that, since that requires the Google Support Design library for backporting features before Lollipop.

title: Desktop verison of the app?
body:
Is there a desktop version of the Book-Catalogue? Or a another desktop application which can synchronize with the android app?

Android version is great for adding book by scanning ISBN, and for walking through the bookstore, but I would like to have an ability to use full-sized keyboard, screens, and mouse to do sorting, correction, etc. It is also more easy to do backups from a desktop machine than from a hand-held device.

title: Update cover "from camera" forces a square image
body:
I added a book, for which no one provided cover yet (yeah that happens :) )
I tried to replace the cover "from camera". The camera turned on, I managed to make a good portrait-style photo (height>width) of the cover, but then the square box appears and I am forced to replace the cover thumbnail with a square image, cutting off top and bottom of the original image.

title: Choose another barcode-scanner
body:
**Problem:**
Its for me right now not possible to scan with the barcode-scanner. I installed instead the "QR Scanner" that is working perfectly fine. Now, when i uninstall the "barcode-scanner" the book-catalogue does not ask me what app i would like to use, instead it just opens "untis" for whatever reason. 

**Possible solution:**
So, please make it possible to choose your own barcode scanner, or like https://github.com/brarcher/loyalty-card-locker with an direclty included barcode scanner.

**Android Version:**
7.1.2

**App Version:**
3.8.1 (through f-droid)
(I tried with 5.0.7 too, fyi, same problem)

If more information is needed, please tell me. 

Greets

title: Searching Amazon fails
body:
When I try to add a book by scanning or entering the ISBN, I get an error message, Search failed while Searching Amazon, no data found for [the ISBN number]. However, it still enters the data (at least most of it) as though it had found the book.

I don't know how much of a problem it is. It just started happening yesterday, when I tried to add three older (1988-2001) titles. The titles are available from Amazon and show the book covers, but the book covers were missing from the data. I tried some other titles today, and got the same error message, but the data included the covers.

I restarted my tablet (an Nvidia Shield with Nougat). Same error. In case it was due to data corruption, I tried my old Pantech tablet with Ice Cream Sandwich and an old copy of my catalogue. Same error.

This is a wonderful app. I have over 1300 titles in my catalogue and I haven't had any problems before. I wanted to call it to your attention because the error message is disconcerting.

title: image size reduced after update
body:
Hi
The app updated recently, and now the image on the book page is tiny! It used to be a decent size so you could see it, now it is barely 2x1cm! You only see anything when you click on edit. I don't want to have to do this everytime I just want to look at items.  Please can this be fixed. Otherwise I will try to uninstall the update.

There is no option for changing this in preferences.  The 'large thumbnail' option only changes the size of the image in the bookshelf list. If it is a concern around the size of the database, please make it a preference, so that those of us who want it can have it.

I have enjoyed using your app for many years and recommend it to everyone, but this has really made me upset and wonder if I should keep using it. Tiny pictures are no good for anyone.

title: Unneeded comma at end of line in CSV export
body:
When exporting to CSV there is appended a comma to end of every line, even to header line. I think this is not CSV standard and gave me problems when reading CSV.

So before handling CSV I open it in LibreOffice and then save it. This way the comma disappears.

I created a small program which allows me to import the bookcatalogue to calibre, retaining some metadata and covers.

Book Catalogue . . . Transferring csv file from email to new phone

title: Feature request: move/add multiple books to a new bookshelf
body:
Hi
Love the app, it has saved me from carrying around reams of paper lists, and aided my need for organisation and keeping lists of everything. I have been using it for many years now, and I recommend it to everyone I can. I even keep all my music and dvds on it.

Is there any chance you could add a feature to move or add multiple books to a new bookshelf? Like the way android lets you select pictures/files and move them to new locations. But you might just want to add to a new shelf, not move.

I was quite extensive when settings up my bookshelves,  but if I should decide on a new organisation system, it would mean editing each book individually, and while I am sure there are plenty of people out there with many more items than me, it would still take a considerable amount of time as I have almost 3000 items. 
Thanks!

title: Random Select
body:
Hey there. I love your app. I was wondering if it might be possible to add a random select feature. I have so many books sometimes I can't decide which one to read next! Thanks for your time :)

via Email

title: Make as read from long press
body:
Via Email: 

An improvement function request...it would be really nice to have the ability to mark the book read without having to go all the way into the edit mode and further down. If this could be checked from the long-press function, that would be really great. It would also be nice to see that indication in the main detail page or even on the bookshelf page in same way. The way it is currently I will unlikely use that function just because it takes too long to get to, but I would really like to if it was easier.

title: Feature request: Search summary for books
body:
Hi,

it would be great to have a summary list if searching for a book. E.g. if I search a writer or title without the other one the "first match" is chosen. If I search a writer it would be cool to see his/her books. If I search e.g. "For good" as title a unknown book is chosen. But if I know the cover and not the writer I could choose the right one from a summary list.

Thank you for this awesome app!

    <string name="lt_info">Diese App nutzt LibraryThing als Quelle für Buchinformationen und alternative Cover. Um diese Funktionalitäten nutzen zu können, müssen Sie sich bei LibraryThing registrieren (kostenlos) und einen Entwicklerschlüssel anfordern (ebenfalls kostenlos).</string>

  \n
  Informationen zu LibraryThing erhalten Sie im Tab LibraryThing in Hilfe & Verwaltung.</string>

    <string name="reset">Zurücksetzen</string>
    <string name="send_info_text">Klicken Sie auf den Button unten, um Informationen über die letzten Abstürze der App zu sammeln und an einen der Entwickler zu schicken. Dieser Vorgang erstellt eine Sicherheitskopie Ihrer gesamten Datenbank und der Log-Dateien. Wenn Sie eine dieser Dateien nicht verschicken wollen, löschen Sie diese vor dem Senden aus dem Anhang.</string>
    <string name="send_info">Sende Informationen</string>
    <string name="cleanup_files_text">Die Dateien belegen %s Speicherplatz auf der SD-Karte. Log-Dateien und andere Daten werden bei jeder App-Aktualisierung, Sicherungskopie oder wenn die App abstürzt auf der SD-Karte gespeichert. Klicken Sie den Knopf unten, um diese Dateien von der SD-Karte zu entfernen. Wenn Sie Abstürze oder andere Fehler erhalten, ziehen Sie bitte in Betracht, den \'Sende Informationen\' Knopf zuerst zu benutzen.</string>

    <string name="goodreads_label">Goodreads</string>
    <string name="goodreads_auth_blurb_part1">Goodreads ist eine Website, deren ausgewiesener Zweck es ist, \"Menschen zu helfen, um Bücher zu suchen und zu teilen, die sie gern haben\". Sie führt eine umfassende Datenbank von Büchern und Buchbesprechungen, und wenn Sie ein registrierter Benutzer von Goodreads sind, kann BookCatalogue Ihre Bücher, Bücherregale und Buchbesprechnungen exportieren und importieren. BookCatalogue ist eine eigenständige App und erfordert keine Verbindung zu Goodreads, aber wenn Sie möchten, können Sie sich hier registrieren:</string>
    <string name="goodreads_auth_blurb_part2">Als registrierter Nutzer können Sie den Zugriff von BookCatalogue auf Ihre Daten bei Goodreads autorisieren. Drücken Sie dazu den Button unten. Sie werden auf eine Website weitergeleitet, auf der Sie sich bei Goodreads anmelden und den Zugriff autorisieren können. Wir werden Ihr Kennwort nie sehen, und Sie können den Zugriff auf der Website von Goodreads jederzeit beenden. Wegen der Unwägbarkeiten des Webs kann es sein, dass Sie anschließend auf eine leeren Seite landen. Klicken Sie einfach auf den \"Zurück\"-Button, um hierher zurückzukehren!</string>
    <string name="goodreads_auth_blurb_part3">Aber denken Sie daran… Sie müssen nichts davon tun: BookCatalogue funktioniert ganz wunderbar ohne Goodreads!</string>
    <string name="goodreads_url">http://www.goodreads.com</string>
    <string name="authorize_access">Zugriff autorisieren</string>
    <string name="authorize_access_already_auth">Scheinbar haben Sie diese App bereits autorisiert. Alle Funktionen von Goodreads sollten bereits verwendbar sein.</string>
    <string name="goodreads_access_error">Beim Zugriff auf Goodreads ist ein Netzwerkproblem aufgetreten. Bitte überprüfen Sie, ob die Website von Goodreads erreichbar ist. Falls das Problem nicht gelöst werden kann, kontaktieren Sie den Support.</string>

    <string name="hint_booklist_styles_editor">Sie können hier die Liste der Stile einstellen, die in Ihrem Menü für Standard-Stile angezeigt werden.         \n
  \n
  Ein grüner Haken zeigt an, dass ein Stil in der Liste angezeigt wird, und ein rotes Kreuz zeigt an, dass ein Stil nicht angezeigt wird. Beim Klick wird ein grüner Haken zu einem roten Kreuz und umgekehrt.         \n
  \n
  Wenn keine Stile gewählt werden, werden alle Stile angezeigt.         \n
  \n
  Ziehen Sie die Symbole ganz rechts, um die Reihenfolge zu ändern.         \n
  \n
  Mit Klicks im Rest der Zeile können Sie die Details eines bestimmten Stils bearbeiten oder eingebaute Stile klonen.</string>
    <string name="hint_booklist_style_groups">Sie können hier die Hierarchie der Überschriften für einen bestimmten Bücherlistenstil ändern.         \n
  \n
  Ein grüner Haken zeigt an, dass die Überschrift in der Liste angezeigt wird, und ein rotes Kreuz zeigt an, dass sie nicht angezeigt wird. Beim Klick wird ein grüner Haken zu einem roten Kreuz und umgekehrt.         \n
  \n
  Wenn keine Stile gewählt werden, werden alle Stile angezeigt.         \n
  \n
  Ziehen Sie die Symbole ganz rechts, um die Reihenfolge zu ändern.</string>
    <string name="hint_booklist_style_properties">Sie können hier die Charakteristik eines bestimmten Bücherlistenstils bestimmen.         \n
  \n
  Sie können den Namen ändern, die Gruppierung bearbeiten und so die Hierarchie ändern und eine Vielzahl anderer Einstellungen anpassen, um einen Stil zu erstellen, der für Sie passend ist.         \n
  \n
  Ebenso ist es möglich, \'Buchfilter\' zu verwenden, mit denen die Auswahl von Bücher in der Listenanzeige verändert wird, etwa um nur ungelesenen Bücher anzuzeigen.</string>
    <string name="hint_booklist_global_properties">Sie können hier die Standardcharakteristik aller Bücherlistenstile bestimmen.         \n
  \n
  Die meisten Eigenschaften können in individuellen Stilen übersteuert werden, aber die Standardeinstellungen werden hier definiert.         \n
  \n
  Sie können den Hintergrund, die Anzeige von Listen beim Start und eine Vielzahl anderer Einstellungen anpassen, die nach Möglichkeit auf alle Stile angewendet werden.         \n
  \n
  Ebenso können Sie hier das Stilmenü und die Stile selbst bearbeiten.</string>

    <string name="send_books_to_goodreads_blurb">Damit wird Ihre Bibliothek an Goodreads gesendet.         \n
  \n
  Sie können auswählen, ob Sie alle Bücher oder nur die seit der letzten Übertragung geänderten (inklusive aller bisher nicht gesendeten Bücher) senden möchten, oder das Update abbrechen.         \n
  \n
  Wenn Sie noch nie Bücher gesendet haben, ist kein Unterschied zwischen den ersten beiden Optionen.</string>

    <string name="hint_authors_book_may_appear_more_than_once">Ein Buch kann mehrfach in einer Liste erscheinen, wenn es bei jedem Autor angezeigt wird. In diesem Fall führt das Löschen eines Buchs zum Löschen aller Vorkommen von der Liste.</string>
    <string name="hint_series_book_may_appear_more_than_once">Ein Buch kann mehrfach in einer Liste erscheinen, wenn es bei jeder Serie angezeigt wird. In diesem Fall führt das Löschen eines Buchs zum Löschen aller Vorkommen von der Liste.</string>
    <string name="hint_background_tasks">Sie können hier die jetzt laufenden Aufgaben und erledigte, mit Fehlern oder anderen Ereignissen beendete Aufgaben sehen. Nach dem Klick auf eine Aufgabe können Sie die mit dieser Aufgabe verbundenen Ereignisse sehen und die Aufgabe mit den verbundenen Ereignissen löschen.</string>
    <string name="hint_background_task_events">Sie können hier die mit einer Hintergrundaufgabe verbundenen Ereignisse sehen. Nach dem Klick auf ein Ereignis können Sie eine Vielzahl von Aktionen durchführen, die für dieses Ereignis passen.</string>

    <string name="hint_startup_screen">Das ist der Standard-Startbildschirm von BookCatalogue. Sie könne auch direkt in \'Meinen Bücher\' starten; der bevorzugte Startbildschirm kann in den Einstellungen geändert werden.</string>
    <string name="upgrading_ellipsis">Upgrade läuft…</string>
    <string name="explain_goodreads_no_isbn">Das gewählte Buch hat keine ISBN; eine automatische Synchronisation mit Goodreads ist nicht möglich. Die einfachste Lösung ist:         \n
  \n
  (1) löschen Sie das Buch aus BookCatalogue         \n
  \n
  (2) fügen Sie das Buch manuell in Goodreads auf der Website ein.         \n
  \n
  (3) Synchronisieren Sie mit Goodreads         \n
  \n
  Damit wird das Buch in BookCatalogue wieder erzeugt und die beiden sind von nun an verbunden.</string>
    <string name="explain_goodreads_no_match">Die ISBN des gewählten Buchs könnte nicht in Goodreads gefunden werden. Dafür gibt es zwei mögliche Ursachen: Entweder sind die Daten des Buchs falsch (Sie sollten die ISBN überprüfen) oder das Buch gibt es nicht in googdreads.         \n
  \n
  Wenn Sie die Daten in BookCatalogue ändern, drücken sie den \'Wiederholen\'-Button und überprüfen Sie, ob die Hintergrundaufgabe erfolgreich ist.         \n
  \n
  Wenn die Daten korrekt wirken und das Buch trotzdem nicht gefunden wird, muss ein Buch mit dieser ISBN manuell zu Goodreads über deren Website hinzugefügt werden. Sobald das geschehen ist, können Sie versuchen, das Buch erneut zu senden.</string>

    <string name="new_in_42"><p><b>Neu in 4.2</b>\n
  \n
            * Datumswähler unterstützt Datumsangaben ab dem Jahr 0 und unvollständige Datumsangaben\n
  \n
            * Beschreibungen in HTML werden korrekt dargestellt und bearbeitet\n
  \n
            * Einstellung zur Auswahl des gesamten Bilds beim Beschnitt\n
  \n
            * Einstellung zur automatischen Drehung des Bilds von der Kamera\n
  \n
            * Einstellung zur Auswahl eines externen Werkzeugs zum Bildbeschnitt (experimentell)\n
  \n
            * Zusätzliche Einträge im Optionsmenü\n
  \n
            * Aktualisierte französische Übersetzung (Imkal)\n
  \n
            * Aktualisierte deutsche Übersetzung (Robert Wetzlmayr)\n
  \n
            * Aktualisierte russisch Übersetzung (Nick Silin)\n
  \n
            * Aktualisierte Positionen der Buttons OK/Abbrechen in Übereinstimmung mit den Android-Standards\n
  \n
            * Vollständige Tastatur bei der Eingabe von ASINs\n
  \n
            * Die fünf letzten Exportdateien bleiben erhalten\n
  \n
            * Bessere Erkennung von \'Änderungen\' beim Bearbeiten von Büchern\n
  \n
            * Unterstützung für eine größere Auswahl von Galerien und Dateibrowsern\n
  \n
            * Verlässlichere Verarbeitung von Datumswerten beim Import/Export/Sync\n
  \n
            * Bessere Erkennung von doppelten Anthologietitlen\n
  \n
            * Verschiedene Fehlerkorrekturen\n
  \n
            Vielen Dank an alle Betatester und Übersetzer!\n
  \n
            Grunthos ist an allen Fehlern und Bugs schuld. Und schicken Sie uns Bugreports.          </p></string>
    <string name="new_in_421"><p><b>Neu in 4.2.1</b>\n
  \n
            * Kein Absturz beim Ausklappen von Listen  mit \'Alles ausklappen\'\n
  \n
            </p></string>
    <string name="bad_scanner">Anscheinend ist Ihre derzeitige Scanner-App nicht mit Book Catalogue kompatible. Wir empfehlen, die App \"Zxing Barcode Scanner\" zu installieren. Falls sie bereits installiert ist, empfehlen wir eine Deinstalltion und erneute Installation.</string>
    <string name="new_in_422"><p><b>Neu in 4.2.2</b>\n
  \n
            * Verbesserte Kachelanordnung des Hintergrundbilds in manchen Android-Versionen\n
  \n
            * Bessere Behandlung inkopatibler Scanner-Apps\n
  \n
            * Sende mehr Details bei Abstürzen oder Hilfeanfragen\n
  \n
            * Layout-Bereinigung (Nick Silin)\n
  \n
            * Fehlerbehebungen\n
  \n
            </p></string>
    <string name="new_in_423"><p><b>Neu in 4.2.3</b>\n
  \n
            * Verbessertes Behandlung ungültiger ISBNs während der Übertragung zu Goodreads\n
  \n

  \n
            </p></string>

    <!-- Heading for scanner-related preferences -->

    <!-- Preference name, displayed in a preference activity -->
    <string name="beep_if_scanned_isbn_valid">Tonsignal bei gültig gescannter ISBN</string>
    <string name="new_in_424"><p><b>Neu in 4.2.4</b>\n
  \n
        * Eine schreibgeschützte Ansicht der Buchdetails mit \'Wischgesten\'-Unterstützung! (Siehe \"Weitere Einstellungen\") (Nick Silin)\n

  \n

    <!-- Hint text displayed when user enters the book listw -->

    <!-- Hint text displayed when user enters the 'read-only' book view -->
    <string name="hint_view_only_help">Das ist die schreibgeschützte Ansicht der Buchdetails; Sie können nach links oder rechts wischen, um zu anderen Büchern zu wechseln,     und ein Buch über das Menü \"Einstellungen\" mit Hilfe des Menü-Buttons oder des Menü-Symbols bearbeiten.</string>

    <!-- This is the heading of the 'Details' tab when editing a book. It needs to be short. "Book Details" is too long. -->

    <!-- This is the heading of the 'Loan' tab when editing a book. It needs to be short. "Loan Book" is too long. -->

    <!-- Hint displayed when an export or database backup is done -->

  \n
  Für eine vollständige Sicherung müssen Sie den Inhalt des Verzeichnisses \'bookCatalogue\' von Ihrer SD-Karte an einen anderen Ort kopieren.     \n
  \n
  Eine detaillierte Anleitung dazu finden Sie in unseren FAQ. Sie finden einen Link dorthin unter \'Hilfe\').</string>

    <!-- Button text on the goodreads activity; only displayed after user has registered -->

    <!-- Extra text displayed on the goodreads activity when a user HAS registered -->

    <string name="please_select_a_non_directory">Bitte wählen Sie eine Datei, kein Verzeichnis</string>

    <!-- This is pretty close to the expected feature list! It is a merge of 424 and 430... -->
    <string name="new_in_500"><p><b>Neu in 5.0.0</b>\n
  \n
        * Eine schreibgeschützte Ansicht der Buchdetails mit \'Wischgesten\'-Unterstützung! (Siehe \"Weitere Einstellungen\") (Nick Silin)\n
  \n
        * Archiv des gesamten Katalogs inklusive Büchern, Buchcover, Einstellungen und Stilen (Sicherung und Import)\n
  \n
        * Aktualisiertes Benutzerinterface mit Unterstützung für den Action Bar mit verbesserter Benutzerfreundlichkeit und besserer Eignung für Geräte ohne Menübuttons\n
  \n
        * Unterstützung des pic2shop-Scanners (besser geeignet für feste Brennweiten, bei schlechten Lichtverhältnissen und für Front-Kameras)\n

  \n
        * Weitere Updates der russischen Übersetzung (Nick Silin)\n

  \n

  \n

    <!-- Displayed in Admin menu advanced options (top make a copy of the internal database on the sdcard -->

    <!-- Brief descriptionn -->
    <string name="preferences_blurb">Einstellungen und benutzerdefinierte Stile</string>
    
    <!-- Explanatory note for export date (not yet implemented) -->
    <string name="export_advanced_date_blurb">Geben Sie wahlweise ein Datum an, um Bücher und Cover auszuwählen:</string>
    
    <!-- Explanatory note for export date (not yet implemented) -->
    <string name="all_books_added_or_updated_since">Alle neuen und aktualisierten Bücher seit:</string>

    <string name="all_books_added_or_updated_since_last_full_backup">Alle neuen und aktualisierten Bücher seit der letzten vollständigen Sicherung</string>

    <!-- Short text for 'n books' -->
    <plurals

    <string name="a_comma_b">%1$s, %2$s</string>

    <string name="searching_directory_ellipsis">Durchsuche Verzeichnis…</string>

    <string name="hint_book_list">Tippen Sie auf ein Buch, um dessen Details zu sehen. Ein langer Druck auf einen Listeneintrag zeigt weitere Optionen.</string>

    <string name="default_bookshelf_name">Standard</string>
    <!-- A hint describing the benefit of following the Amazon links -->
    <string name="hint_amazon_links_blurb"><p>Wenn Sie Produkte von Amazon kaufen, nachdem Sie die Menüpunkte <i>\"%1$s\"</i>, <i>\"%2$s\"</i> oder <i>\"%3$s\"</i> gewählt haben, wird ein Anteil des Kaufpreises an die Entwickler von %4$s weitergeleitet.</p><p>Sie können auch die <a href=\"\"https://github.com/eleybourn/Book-Catalogue/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions-%%28FAQ%%29\"\">Links in unserer Hilfe</a> verwenden, um direkt zu Amazon oder PayPal zu gelangen.</p></string>

    <!-- Name of the new style grouping (needs to be short). -->

        <!-- Name of the new style grouping (needs to be short). -->

        <!-- Name of the new style grouping (needs to be short). -->

        name="n_stars">

        <item quantity="one">%1$s Stern</item>
        <item quantity="other">%1$s Sterne</item>

  \n

    <!-- Credits in the 'about' dialog -->
    <string name="translators_blurb">BookCatalogue ist das Ergebnis der Arbeit vieler Personen und würde nicht so weit verbreitet sein ohne die großzügige Arbeit unserer freiwilligen Übersetzer: Eugenio Davolio, José M. Galdo, Imkal, Gideon van Melle, Emir Sarı, Nick Silin und Robert Wetzlmayr (falls wir jemanden vergessen haben, geben Sie uns bitte Bescheid).</string>

title: trying to Import Archive, keeps crashing
body:

So, my phone failed on me, or was failing. I copied the entire folder to my pc, did a factory reboot, and moved it all back.

title: Feature Request: Reset search filter
body:
After I've done a sequence of searches, and then want to return to the complete book list, it seems the only way to do it is to go back through all the search results. It would be handy if doing a search with a blank field did the reset.

John

title: Feature Request: Edit book series # to start in numeric mode
body:
When you add a book to a series, the # field starts in number, not alphabet mode, which is handy. But when you go back and edit the field, it does not. It would be useful for it to consistently start in numeric mode.

John

title: Feature Request: Suggestions popup in lent-to field
body:
I like the suggestions popup when entering series information, could it also be added when entering the borrower information in the Loan tab?

I've been using the Loan/Location fields somewhat unconventionally. I want to have most series under their single author, but I have some series of books with multiple authors, and to keep them together I put the Series in the borrower field, and the series number in Location, so a sort order display of Borrower/Location/Author/Series handles both cases.

Having a lookup for Borrower makes this more foolproof, but also helps people who just lend many books to the same person.

Thanks

John

title: Feature request: Series complete checkbox
body:
Hi,

I use Book Catalogue to keep track of my manga collection. It would be handy to be able to mark a series as complete and be able to filter out to make it easier to go through to see if there are any new books published.

Cheers.

title: Feature Request - "Missing Series Books" Bookshelf with autofill
body:
Great App.

One thing that would be very useful is an automatically filled bookshelf called "Missing Series Books" that goes through the existing bookshelves (or at least the main one), and see which books in a series are not included somewhere in the lists.

This serves 2 purposes.  First if a book in the series was missed, this will notify the user they should go back and get it.  Second if a new book comes out it will let the user know that the next book has become available so they can keep current.

Example - the user has all the Women's Murder Club books through 13 but is missing 3.  The "Missing Series Books" would autofill with James Patterson "3rd Degree", "14th Deadly Sin" and "15th Affair".

Once the user gets the book they can move it from the "missing" bookshelf to a regular bookshelf.

Thanks for the great app.

title: Surround ISBN with quotes on CSV export?
body:
A frequently-written comment/FAQ/workaround is to import BookCat's csv exports with the ISBN forced to be seen as text, to avoid the recipient program (such as Excel) from treating the field as numbers (thus losing the leading zero and/or rounding them to 978 * e^10).

Question/Suggestion: why not "simply" _export_ it as text, by putting quotes (") around that field's data?

That would help make the external apps handle it (hopefully) properly and avoid much frustration 

thank you for your continuing efforts

title: Transferring data to a new device.
body: I'm having trouble transferring my data from Book Catalogue to a new device.  I'm going from a Samsung Galaxy to a Motorola.  I've tried syncing the phones through my google account.  I've tried backing it up to an sd card, but it doesn't work.  Any suggestions would be appreciated.

title: Import from CSV
body:
Hello,
Firstly, thanks for this software. It works well.

I have a lot of Ebooks and I wanted to import them into my catalogue so I wrote some software to extract data from each Ebook and build a csv file for import.

I formatted the csv file as your documentation said, but it would not import all my books, it seemed to stop after around 200 or so books.

So I exported my existing books to a CSV file, checked the format and found that there is an extra field 'language' (after "genre") that doesn't appear in the documentation.

Even after adding this field to my csv file, it seems that I can't get some books to import. It still seems to stop after about 200 books or so (I'm importing around 600 books in one csv file).

The most likely cause is that there is an issue with my CSV file format (I'm still looking at it).

My questions are:
1) Is there a limit to the number of books that can be imported from a csv file?
2) Is there a way I can quickly delete all books in the database leaving all other data untouched (author/genre/bookshelves etc)? So far I've uninstalled, re-installed and recovered a backup, this seems to do it but it's a bit drastic.

My best regards, Andrew Bools.

title: Not an issue, just a recommendation. Not sure the proper forum for this.
body:
I have been using Book-catalogue for a few years now.  I was wondering if there was a way to have the loaned book information sync to goodreads. Goodreads does not have a loan option, so I was thinking it can be made as a note, or somehow attached to the note section. It would have to be an option that is turned on and off by users as some use the Note section in Goodreads for other information, but i'm one that doesn't use it, so was thinking it can be used as a defacto place to input the loan information... more specifically, the name of the user.  

When in goodreads, if we put anything in the note (a name of a person), it would go to the loaned section in Catalogue. If we delete it in goodreads, it would remove the loan.

I don't know if this is possible, I don't have any coding knowledge.   If you are somehow able to do this, Book-Catalogue would be the only app with this option out there. WOULD BE SOOOOO COOL!

I'm a teacher and use your app to keep track of the books my students borrow from my classroom.

Cheers!
Vito P

title: Improve sync with Goodreads
body:
Great app! I am finally realizing my long-standing wish of inventorying my library. :)

The sync with Goodreads seems to be a simple pull-push, rather than looking for changes since last update. Updates to data like title, cover, or isbn don't seem to get pushed to the Goodreads copy of the book (though that may be partially because the app version was initially created without an isbn). I realize that a true merge with conflict handling is complicated, but could we set the priority, so that either Goodreads overwrites the app or the app overwrites Goodreads? Or is that not possible through the Goodreads interface?

I've also noticed that ebooks imported to Goodreads from my Amazon account don't seem to be recorded fully in the app-- the isbn and cover are missing. All the data shows in my Goodreads account, though, including the isbn....

title: Thumbnails on highres screens
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
Via email

Hi,

I have been using Book Catalogue for a while without issues on a moto-g,
I really like this application, it's very useful to keep track of my
comic collection.

Recently I have changed my mobile phone (it's a samsung s4 GT-I9505 with
a recent version of cyanogenmod).

I moved the library, creating a backup, and imported it on the s4, all
books were properly imported, all the thumbnails are present, and can be
seen in the book list and book edit pages, however the majority of
thumbnails weren't visible in the book detail page.

I have tried to replicate the problem without having to import the
database, and I can reproduce the issue with a clean installation of
book catalogue, by simply adding the book with isbn 9788877591937.

With a closer inspection of the screenshot (attached), the thumbnail is
not absent, but it shows as a small line of pixels.

I thought that it can be somehow related to the resolution of the
thumbnail and did some tests changing the image sizes.

If the thumbnail has a resolution of 200x193 the detail page shows the
image, if the thumbnail has a resolution of 200x194 it is not visible
(or is shrinked).

I suspect the issue has something to do with the high screen resolution
of the device (1080 x 1920) and the proportion ratio of the thumbnail
and how those two are combined to calculate the final thumbnail size.

Attached also the backup of the archive, and the database dump.

If needed I can do other tests in order to debug the issue, I am a
developer and know my way on a linux system (unfortunately I don't know
enough about android development to provide a patch).

I would really appreciate it if you could find some time to look into
this issue.

thanks

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/236568/16470937/efbd1ffe-3e8b-11e6-9de0-b31ed05cdbb1.png)

title: The application directory should be cleaned
body:
Currently the application uses `/storage/emulated/0/bookCatalogue` for its data (on my device at least) but the content of that directory is barely legible. I'm checking this directory because I put my exports in there by default, as the application suggests, and finding the export files is harder and harder when the number of covers grows.

All the thumbnails are in there, as well as the export files (by default) and some other files I don't know about (`covers.db`, `error.log`).

I'm not yet finished digitalizing the data of my library, but all I can see are the covers (300+ files). It's hard to find the export files, for instance.

I believe that the application should use several subdirectories inside the `bookCatalogue` directory.

For instance I would do the following:
- leave the exports in `bookCatalogue` as it's something people actively want and expect to find in the default directory of the application;
- move the thumbnails (and `covers.db`?) into `bookCatalogue/covers` so that the big part of the data is "hidden" away;
- move the logs to `bookCatalogue/log`.

title: Moving user-created styles doesn't work
body: I created a custom "Editor" style and wanted to move it after the built-in "Genre" style as the UI allows me to do, but it wouldn't move and stays at the top of the styles list.

title: "Language" field content should be translated
body:
Each book can have a language associated to it. It is referenced under the "language" field. The content of that language is not translated.

For instance, I'm using the application in French. I add books written in French. Under the "language" field, I should then see "français", but instead I see "French".

I checked for the text "French" in the source code, but it never appears as is, out of any context. I suppose then that this field is taken as is from the sources. Would it be possible to add a way to translate it if such a translation is available?

This will probably require that strings.xml contains all the language names, but it shouldn't be too hard to have those translations found / done for supported languages. I can do it for French, for instance if given a list of language names you want to be translated and a template to put into, similar to

```
<string name="language_[language name in English]">[language name in French]</string>
```

Example:

```
<string name="language_French">français</string>
```

![screenshot_20160118-161230](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/666970/12395005/727ffa78-bdff-11e5-911e-0756ef2982e1.png)

title: Fix French translation
body:
- Use "«" and "»" as they are the unique correct French quotes (see https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guillemet#Usage_des_guillemets_en_fran.C3.A7ais)
- Fix usage of upper- and lower-case text (see https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Usage_des_majuscules_en_fran%C3%A7ais)
- Fix usage of punctuation (see https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ponctuation)
- Fix various typos, plural/singular usages, etc.

There's more work to do, but it's a start

title: Make auto-capitalization optional
label: [Label(name="In Beta")]
body:
The application in its current form considers only the English language when it comes to book title capitalization.

In French, the capitalization of titles is totally different and the rules are really complex (it depends on the kind of title: is it a sentence or just words, what words are used, the order of the words, etc.).

Most of the time, Amazon and friends get those correct but the application tries its best by applying the English language rule which forces me to manually (and painfully) edit every single title. Also, when editing a title, the application forces me in a "capitalizing" keyboard, which is painful because I most often have to uncapitalize letters, forcing me to select the letter, remove capitalization then rewrite the letter.

The rules for capitalization in French are complex and I don't expect an application to get them right without proper French semantic analysis. The English Wikipedia has a summary of how [French titles should be capitalized](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/France_and_French-related#Capitalization). Yet it doesn't cover everything, which is actually a kind of compromise, and [more covered on the French Wikipedia](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikip%C3%A9dia:Conventions_typographiques#Titres_d.27.C5.93uvres_.28livres.2C_films.2C_etc..29). Therefore I'm not asking that you implement the titles under those rules for French titles, but rather make the English rules optional to follow what the book sources provided.

So, concretely, please make these two functionalities (auto-capitalization and capitalizing keyboard) optional under a preference.

title: Feature/update dependencies
body:
Added ability to set Amazon and Goodreads API parameters independently on code.
1) Now it is used only for `release` builds. So do not have to create custom classes with stub values 
if you working on `debug` version
2) Code is not dependent on this values and will be built anyway;
3) Even `release` build will be successfully built, if you do not change the values in `api.properties`.
You have to replace the values only if you want to use this functionality. All is up to you

title: Adding image url in the CSV file
body:
This is a wonderful app. I was looking for someone to build such an app that will help me to build up a db but here it is! 

This app stands out for 2 major reasons
1. It retrieves the book description! and
2. the book cover; 
the main things that users in a library would pay attention in a db, aside the lookups function of other info.

The only thing I would need would be to add the image url in the CSV file.

The problem right is that
1. It is impossible to have the book cover outside the app. There's no app to retrieve data from .bkbc
2. I have to to still add image to the added books one by one or to find and add the relevant image url to each book.

title: Use Outpan's open data API
body:
Hey guys,

I'm the founder of Outpan.com. We are a free and open database of products and have one of the largest and most complete book (ISBN) databases in the world.

We have several large book collection/cataloging apps using our API and I thought Outpan might be useful for this project too.

Let me know if you have any questions/feedbacks.

title: Turkish fixes:
body:
i) Replace "betik" with "kitap". There was a partial patch in 83860a4cefc14878, this commit replaces all occurrences.
Using "betik" instead of kitap is an esoteric attempt to remove the arabic loan word "kitap" and use the pure Turkish word "betik" instead.
"betik" technically means any written document but never used in place of "kitap" in modern Turkish.
It comes from the ancient Turkish word "bitig" (written documents, books, etc).
"betik" has a place in modern Turkish as a translation for "script".

ii) Remove the esoteric "Tor beti" with "Ağ sayfası" (web page).
"sayfa" is again an arabic load word, although "ağ" is Turkish, however "tor" is used by other Turkic nations, although not Turkey.
"bet" is coming from the "bitig" root "bit(i)" (see above).
Almost 99.99% of the Turks won't have a clue about "tor beti" which is again an attempt
to replace the loan words (actually just the "web" part) with pure Turkish (and a bit invented) words.

title: Maximum number of books
body:
Hi
I'm planning on using your app for a relatively straightforward way of uploading a number of books in my small secondhand bookshop to my Amazon seller account via the BookLoader inventory spreadsheet (to save me A LOT of typing!).
I was just wondering if there is a maximum number of books / entries that your app supports, both in terms of the app itself and in the export file? Ideally I will be able to use it to inventory my entire Amazon stock at once, which may be up to around 10,000 books. If it won't support this number then I will have to export the data to a different piece of inventory management software before  exporting to Amazon. That will be fine (just take a bit longer), but I just need to know before I start!
Thanks
Krystl
PS - perhaps you should consider having an alternative export option where the format matches the format required by amazon - I would happily pay a reasonable amount for this! There are very few free book inventory management software out there and it can be quite awkward to convert to Amazon format. Also, none of them (that I have found so far) include an app with a barcode scanner.

title: FWIW, votes
body:
Thanks for a great app.  Finally got around to donating.  Definitely worth a few six-packs of decent beer ;)

Bulk modify would be very helpful; I've seen other requests for it.  I just moved half my collection to new shelves we just built. Before, I had an "in my head" filing system that was outgrowing my head, so half my books should be in location newShelves (and are alphabetical) and the other half is in the original location in "ad hoc" sort.

Maybe go into "bulk select" mode and have checkboxes instead of green "read" checkmarks.  Guess you could export to CSV, but I'm nervous about that given some of Excel's idiosyncrasies.  On that note, I've seen discussions that imply loading different (bcbk?) lists and merging them, but can't find that anywhere.  Do you use different directories?

I'd add another vote for sort by added date full granularity.  Now it has each day, then listed by author.  If I'm spending a Saturday adding books and realized that a certain series or logging handwriting on covers needed to be fixed, it would help if I could get an in-order list to debug when the screwups started.

Add another vote for honorific fields, etc.  Would help sorting by last name, but I don't know what the locale implications are.  Would also be interesting to know how many books I have by PhD's vs. D.D.'s vs. MD's, etc.

Calibre integration w/ pics would be cool, but I realize that would be non-trivial.

title: Sum of books in category needs category name printed
body: I got sums working once, I think with a custom sort, but without bookshelf/author printed.  Would be nice to display by e.g. bookshelf with the total books in that bookshelf beside it.  The "summary details in header" in book list preferences doesn't seem to have an effect on categories like bookshelves.

title: Losing data on screen change
body:
When I'm editing a book, and I go to the Author screen or the Edit Description screen, I lose changes in stuff like #pages, publisher, etc. if I am modifying an internet download.  I have to re-enter it, which is an annoyance when trying to figure out how to catalog a bunch of books that were published < 1900.  Basically I just learned to hit the save button on certain operations, which once I got into the rhythm of it, wasn't too awful bad.  I think it happened a time or two on screen rotates or something like that also.

Using Book Catalogue 5.1.2 on Android 4.4.2.  Thanks for a great app.

title: Date rollback, off-by-one and CSV date export format
body:
When I have a book that only has a year published data, I usually use 1/1/<year> or 6/15/<year> as the date so average age calculations work better.  If you do that and save the book, when you tap it in All Books, the read-only screen shows the date as date - 1 day.  If you edit the book, the date is correct.

Also, when you export to CSV, the date is sometimes mm-dd-yy and others are mm/dd/yy, other times mm-yy.  Personally, I'd like mm/dd/yyyy or you could just use straight up ctime().  If no month or day is given, split the difference, and use consistent separators.

Using Book Catalogue version 5.1.2 on Android 4.4.2

title: adding Some comments on building
body:
Hi, 

Thanks all for the project documentation that is pretty good.
I would like to suggest to add some details not found in file 'BUILDING' that took me some time : 

Step 1 (could maybe be done in Git repo if it doesn't break the release build): 
- create a src folder in StartupActivity named "localsrc"
- create an empty class com.eleybourn.bookcatalogue.amazon.AmazonAppKey in that folder
  - add field public static final String KEY = null; to this class
- create an empty com.eleybourn.bookcatalogue.goodreads.GoodreadsApiKeys in that folder
  - add field public static final String GOODREADS_DEV_KEY = null ;
  - add field public static final String GOODREADS_DEV_SECRET = null ; 

Step2 : let amazon integration works by following how to at : https://developer.amazon.com/appsandservices/apis/earn/mobile-associates

Step3 : let GoodReads integration by filling the form found at https://www.goodreads.com/api/keys (goodreads account required)

Regards 
Christophe Brethes.

title: another suggestion
body:
I'm back :-) with what I think would be a pretty easy to implement improvement...

Wouldn't it be nice if one could change the input type from the lookup pages (enter isbn, search internet, and add manually), if there were a button one could switch to other types (including scan) from. (clear?)
When I am doing a row of books, I frequently have to switch from one type to another ...back out, click up, wait for menu, etc. It would be nice to go directly. (I don't include the isbn scan page as a lookup, cause it jumps to a different app and I imagine it would be impossible...? It would be ideal though...) This way I could do everything in two passes, one pass for all the scannable isbn's and another pass for lookups (combined).

Even if you don't like the suggestion, I should I appreciate what you have done. Why am I giving you so many suggestions? I've tried a bunch of other similar book apps, all quite unsatisfying, and this one finally does what it is supposed to do. Hooray!

title: Dissallow duplicate bookshelf names and auto-merge renamed shelves
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
It seems two shelves with the same name can be created. This should not be allowed.

Ideally also, we should allow shelf merges much like we do for authors.

title: suggestions
body:
app is working well. I have always hoped I could scan in my library of >3000 books, and it now it looks like it might be manageable!

A few suggestions for improvements:
1. You can sort the main list by date added, but I would like sort it by time added...not date, so I can see the books most recently added at the top...
2. I have been able to import the csv file into calibre using import list plugin in calibre, but the following issues arise:
   multiple authors are separated by "|" but that bombs. I need to manually change those to other things.
   There is no way to import pictures, as far as I can see. I guess uuid could be used for that, but I am not sure how that would be done. This is a shame, since you have already gone to the trouble of getting the pictures, it would be nice not to have to tell calibre to redo it. 
3. There appears to be no way to change the bookshelf for a particular item, or better yet, a group of items. In fact, some multibook field editing would be a nice feature. 
4. GUI would be improved if long clicking  at the appropriate place near book field (without interfering with the copy/paste longclick) would automatically bring you to the edit page  & field, instead of clicking at the top + scrolling. And then, being able to swipe from book to book in edit mode would be nice, too.

title: cross-feed and/or cross-check 10 and 13 digits ISBN
label: [Label(name="In Beta")]
body:
Most books have both 13- and 10-digit ISBNs, but BookCat does not notice duplicates if one was entered as 10-digit and the second was entered as 13 (or vice versa).

Use case: i tend to key in ISBNs manually, since i'm faster than the scanner process, and the scanner process mis-fills (or requires painful override for things like shelves and anthology keys).  It's easier for me to do the 10-digit ;-).

Possibly the best win would be for a user-option for  either form of ISBN entry to fill "both" fields (i realize that it's probably currently a single field, and possibly the primary key), or for BookCat to "fake" the 2nd form.

thanks
--richard  seymour

title: title field reset after change in serie field
body:
I've had this issue for quite some time now, and I thought there was already an issue about it, but can't find it anymore.

Here is the case. I had a book by scanning it's barcode. Many fields are already completed by the search, but quite often, the Serie field is not filled. In fact, quite often, the serie data is found in the title field, along with the title.
I correct the title, and then enter the serie form to add the serie. Either by canceling the action or by validating the serie added, I'm brought back to the main form, and find that the title field has been reset to its search value.
In fact, I have to complete author(s) and serie(s) before touching the title field. Though I haven't tested it, I guess the same goes for any field on the main form. As soon as you go to a sub-form (author or serie, for example), the fields reset to their search value.

I've had this issue since Android 4.1 (as far as I remember) and up to 4.4 (not ye tested on 5.0), sunce BookCatalogue 5.0 up to the latest version (few days ago, which prompted me to check this issue once again). I can reproduce it anytime.

title: "Read" and "Signed" text may be anachronistic
body:
The "read" and "signed" texts are both of the for "has the book been ...?"

This is consistent with a chatty style, but not necessarily very helpful in some languages. It may also conflict with the usual use for a checkbox.

We should consider replacing these with definite statements, such as "This books is signed"/"This book has been read", or replacing the checkbox with a radio button with "Yes/No". Since the simplest UI is ideal, probably the former is the best approach.

title: Locale-based searching
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
## Background
### The Problem

Users search for, say, german books in germany and get english descriptions.

This is not always the case, but is likely if the search is done by title, or if the ISBN was reused.

The Amazon API, and maybe others, support locales. Amazon supports 10 of them.
### Some Issues

Unfortunately, the Amazon API (when searching in Germany), does NOT always return English books; meaning we get "no results".

If an ISBN has been reused, then the user may want English or German versions.
## An Approach

Allow the user to to the following:
- specify the order of search engines (we have to be careful because LibraryThing does not support Author/Title searches, so they would need to be last in those cases).
- allow the user to specify an (optional) Amazon locale to search
- allow the user to specify goodreads/LT/google locales (if supported)
- each needs to have their own daltabase-specific locale list. They probably don't all support the same set of locales in their API
- put the locale-based search engines at the front of the list, then english-based searches will only be used to "fill in the blanks".
- (optional) allow the user to disable some search engines
- (optional) allow the user to reconfigure this on a per-search basis, and/or have "search profiles" allowing for multiple locales

title: Bug: residual thumbnail after Cancel entry-by-isbn
body:
If i do an enter-by-ISBN, and either the publisher blew it (or reused the ISBN) or if it's one of my "guess the ISBN from the SSN" exercises (see issue 586), i may get the 'wrong" book offered in the entry fields.
OK... so i click Cancel and then choose "Add Book Manually".
The entry screen appears... but the _thumbnail_ from the previous "wrong ISBN" is still there.
From the Entry screen i can't seem to delete it (i have to re-select the book later through MyBooks and Edit it out).

No other field is "polluted" like that, only the thumbnail.

The only (simple) way i've found of clearing it is to do another add-by-isbn that i know will be successful.
Then i can switch to "Add Manually" and i'll be working into a clean (i.e. no thumbnail) Entry screen.

thanks for your consideration

title: Feature request: SSN entry choice on ISBN screen
body:
There are many books carrying an SSN number which can frequently be entered as ISBN by adding a prefix digit and the checksum digit  (if we're lucky, the SSN with checksum may be on the copyright page).  (SSN is also occasionally known as "book seller number")
My request is for a button/check (like the ASIN checkbox) which would ask BookCat to calculate the missing checksum before doing the ISBN lookup.  My current work-around is to prefix with a zero, and then postfix with zero (search/invalid/<= (delete zero)) one (search/invalid/<= (delete one)) two ... (repeat until "valid ISBN" achieved and it does the lookup).
Although tedious, that gives me a better than 70% successful hit rate.
It would be nice if BookCat could remove the tedium of (nearly) blind trial-and-error.

(my workaround triggers a (dare i say it?) bug in BookCatalog, which i'll file as the next issue: residual thumbnail after Cancel)

thanks, great app (donation to follow, making it my first "paid" app)

title: Searching by title is inconsistent
label: [Label(name="Defect")]
body:
Consider adding a very old book e.g. “The Triumph of Time” by James Blish using the internet search method as there is no ISBN code.

Search results in a single but wrong book - James Blish, “Cities in Flight”  (it is a collection of all 4 books in the series of the same name).

 

User actions to correct the situations are:

A.      Substitute the title by retyping, delete the ISBN code as it is irrelevant, delete series info and save it  -  BANG – the wrong ISBN code and title are back. 

B.      Retype the correct title, delete the ISBN code, replace image from the camera –the wrong ISBN code and title are back again.

e.g. http://www.goodreads.com/book/show/6563582-het-oog-van-tzulan contains buth the Dutch title and the original German title.

Thanks in advance.

title: Get ISBN via OCR to add old books
body:
From a user:

> many older books with isbn's don't have bar codes for quick entry. How about implementing an ocr (optical character recognition) reader entry option that reads the numbers following the letters 'isbn'. 

This seems like a non-trivial task, but could be useful. It's the sort of thing Goggles should have done if the API were half-decent.

title: Allow user to choose highest priority icons at top of book lists
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
Currently the order of priority is 'Add', 'Styles' and 'Search'. Some people would put 'Search' at the top of the list.

A system to override the default order might be nice.

title: And another issue with csv
body:
database and csv sent.

I exported the csv file, than added some hundred books , tried it with book_UUID 0 then numbered, doesn´t import at all. Tried to uninstall then install again, nothing...

Sorry to bother!
cheers belabear

title: Add sort style by rating
label: [Label(name="Request")]
body:
Any chance of adding order/ranking by rating? Thanks so much for this app - it's great.  A book from your wishlist is on the way.

Via Email

title: export.csv issue
body: The export.csv file is not available except the 1st 17 entries of near 300. How do I make this work? In the app itself, I have access to all books I have listed, but the csv file does not show them on the computer.

title: ToDo: Allow hiding of headings in lists, but preserve sorting
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body: ie. add a group attribute of 'Hidden'

title: Add a style filter for 'currently reading'
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Soon(tm)"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
(like the read filter).

Would check:

```
'date started reading' not null 
AND ( 'date started reading' > 'date finished reading' /* re-reading */
       OR 'date finished reading' is null
       OR 'read' is false')
```

This would allow a 'currently-reading' style.

title: Read-only display does not display anthology titles.
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body: Probably need a tab or button/dialog; putting it all on the one (long) screen would clutter it up.

title: Legacy data causes data to display incorrectly
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="In Beta")]
body: Some old databases have 'f', 't', 'true', 'false' stored in the 'signed' field. This causes the loading of the read-only view to abort prematurely, with publication details being incorrect.

title: Amazon search fails for new books
body: When adding a new book by ISBN, the search on Amazon fails (since yesterday at least).

title: Almost unreadable author field in add book dialog
label: [Label(name="Stale/No Response")]
body:
The Author field in `name_search.xml` dialog is an `AutoCompleteTextView`. It has white text color on light gray background and can't be read easily. Reproduced on Android 2.3.3 device and emulator.

It seems to be a known issue:
- http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=5237
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8470804/autocompletetextview-color-set-white-by-default

title: Add by Library of Congress Number
body: Is it possible to implement adding a book by their Library of Congress Number. This would be extremely useful for adding books published before 1970.

title: Ability to rename bookshelves
body: This is a wish but the ability to rename bookshelves would nice :)

title: Make title/series mangling optional
body:
We currently capitalize and rearrange titles for sorting purposes, eg "The road" becomes "Road, The". We already have a todo for a separate 'sort' field (so titles will display properly), but we should also add a preference to disable the capitalization entirely since in other languages it is often inappropriate:

(from a user)

> Could you make converting title words starting uppercase (Something Like This) optionable in preferences, because in my primary language we dont use such uppercasing and we write: Something like this. It concerns  title, serie... Now I have to correct it manually and it is very annoying.

title: Archive only selected books
body:
From a user:

> I would like to have a bookshelf one for the books that she's read and one for the books I have read to her and I would like to be able to send her teacher my list of books that she has read

This seems like a very sensible feature to add.

It might be best implemented in after 5.1. Options include:
- from a bookshelf, or from a search result list, select 'Send These Books to Archive'

and/or
- from the 'Advanced' options in the archive allow selection based on:
  - one or more selected shelves
  - book 'read'
  - format 
  - etc etc

The latter _might_ be nice to add to a general 'local search' screen as well.

title: Make the CSV import more data-aware
body: Specifically, at least allow 1, 'true', 'True', 't','T', 'yes', 'Yes', 'y' and 'Y' (and opposites) for booleans.

title: Rating on the app and GoodReads not compatible
body: In the app I'm allowed to rate with half stars, but not on good reads. This should be reworked or or at least a warning should be shown. Actually it would be great if the rating sheme is the same.

title: Book created on GoodReads don't merge on phone
body: I created a book in the app which didn't upload to GoodReads, then I found it on GoodReads marked it as read and synced. Afterwards it was double entry on my phone and the data from good reads was without cover.

title: Unknown error when sync with good reads
body:
The app says for example 11 processed 1 uploaded. Its unclear what this error caused and not which books aren't uploaded.

I guess its a problem with german Umlauts. In 2 titles which aren't synced there is ä or ö in the Author name or in the book title. One book isnt available on GoodReads (see image)
![umlautproblem](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/5122427/1227704/e69af5cc-2796-11e3-98c7-57cb4e2bca3d.png)
 and the other one(http://www.goodreads.com/book/show/8489019-aff-re-im-paradies?ac=1) is available but still not syncing

Update: I've found the book, and the bad umlauts or on goodreads http://www.goodreads.com/book/show/1621641.Aff_re_Im_Paradies

title: Feature Request: Colored bookshelves
body:
If each bookshelf would have its own color of background, it would be easier to recognize which bookshelf is used right now. Less chances to modify one bookshelf, while thinking that you working with another.

Bookshelf's title on top of the screen is just not enough. The title requires suspicion  that something wrong is going on, but if you -believe- you've chose  a correct bookshelf two second ago from the menu - why would you reread the title to check it?

The colored background can work as an additional reminder for specialized bookshelves (like "to buy", "to sell", "to read", "lend to Bob", etc)

title: ISBN entry via Voice
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
Technically, any text field (including the ISBN field) can be entered via voice. Just bring up the keyboard and click on the microphone icon. That said, it often mis-recognizes and/or puts in letters rather than numbers ('H' instead of '8', 'to' instead of '2').

It is possible to put a word-filter on text recognition, and it would be nice if we had a 'microphone' button on the ISBN entry screen.

title: Integrate with epub3reader project
body:
See:

   https://github.com/pettarin/epub3reader

it's an early stage OSS epub3 reader and the developers are open to the idea of intent-based inter-app cooperation! Yay!

The idea being:
- define intents usable by any app to access some basic BC functions
- define intents implemented by a reader app to allow BC to query ePub info

ultimately, it would be great to encourage the major readers to implement these intents and support our intents...but in the mean time, if epub3reader keeps developing (and there is every sign it will) then we have a great way to move forward with reader integration.

title: Could add inventory capabilities?
body: I understand this is a catalogue but is there a way to use it to keep track of my book inventory? Like, how many copies of a book I have, who did I lent my book to, something similar to https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=se.petersson.inventory&hl=en

title: Wish: dealing with real duplicates
body:
Not sure how to do it properly, so it is a "Wish" right now, not a "feature request".
The problem is this:
I have real duplicates - two copies of the same books. On my real bookshelves I just put them into a specially dedicated bookshelf for future sell/donations.
Would like to have an ability to track the contents of this real-life bookshelf  also. Right now the application does inform me that I am adding a duplicate but it is difficult to find such duplicates later - I have to manually scan the list in hope to notice the duplicates. And when I do notice them - I am not really sure is this a real duplicate or just my crooked fingers scanned the same book twice?

One possible solution I see is a field "number of copies" in book description and an ability to hide all single-copy books. This would show what I can suggest for trade during the book-club meetings.

Thoughts?

title: Searches are too general: restrict to author/title?
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="Feature")]
body:
From a user:

> But lately I noticed that search returns lot of incorrect results (results that do not contain words that I searched), and I pinpointed reason:   while search says"Search Author or Title", it in fact search all fields.
> 
> That would not be problem if by "all" it does not also include invisible fields, ie fields that I excluded in "Manage Field Visibility". As it might be suspected, main reason for "false positives" is "Description" field, which usually have pages of text, with high chance to contain word I was searching for.
> 
> It would be good to add option in 'admin/ other preferences' that would be 'Search only visible fields'.

We probably can't limit to visible fields, but we definitely should try to restrict to author/title!

title: Check if pic2shop installed when trying to start it
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="In Beta"), Label(name="Soon(tm)")]
body: Currently, it is possible to set pic2shop as the preferred scanner if it is not installed, and this results in a crash when a user attempts to scan a barcode.

title: UPC to ISBN -- possible?
body:
From a user:

> I read in my library, but I found that many of the books have an older style bar code that couldn't be used. These appear to be a UPC code instead of a ISBN code. With a little hunting around I found that you can convert these UPC codes into an ISBN. Here is a link to the site describing how to do this...
> 
> http://www.librarything.com/wiki/index.php/ISBN
> 
> I also found a good page that defines how to simply calculate the check digit that is needed when converting the UPC code to an ISBN code...
> 
> http://www.teach-ict.com/as_a2_ict_new/ocr/AS_G061/311_data_info_knowledge/validation_verification/miniweb/pg5.htm
> 
> It would be a great addition to the ISBN bar code scanner option to do the following... When the scanner gets a code it doesn't understand, it assume it is a UPC code and try converting it to an ISBN code before giving up. 

Based on a very quick scan of the second web page it looks like it might be possible to do, but I'm not sure how reliable it would be. Also, we may have problems verifying the scan is a UPC vs. just a bad scan.

title: WorldCat support?
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
From a user:

> Worldcat.org is the largest online database of books and periodicals I've ever come across. That database would give your app even more functionality. 

Not sure exactly what it would add over what we have (not saying it won't, just not sure), but if we ever want to support periodicals it might be good.
