title: Integrated wishlist functionality
body:
From a user:

> The "Wishlist" bookshelf should be an integrated part of the app and when a book is scanned a prompt that it is on the wishlist should appear not that it is a duplicate.

There would be a few ways of doing this:
- add the ability to mark a single shelf as a 'Wishlist'
- add a 'wishlist' flag to a book, then use that flag as a filter in book list styles, as well as -- making it a virtual shelf.

I tend to prefer the latter since the 'wishlist' flag is more properly a book attribute and might form the model for other flags in the future (eg. to-read, to-sell) -- though for the most part, I detest the idea of truck loads of flags on a book.

title: book format
body: Is there already a way to add additional formats to the list?  When I enter a book, I have a choice of "hardback, paperback, or spiral bound" but saw references in the wiki to "audiobook" and "companion", and when entering a book by search, had one auto-fill as "e-book".  I would love to be able to do that on purpose!

title: Feature request: collapsed series
body:
When you are using "Author then Series" view and expand an Author - all his/her series are also expands. This behavior is fine for a small series (3-5 books), but then you are storing manga - it become scary. The manga series are often 10-30 books, popular series goes far, for example Inuyasha - 58 volumes, One Piece is 70 volumes and  still continuing...
So, I would really like to see Series collapsed by default. 

In collapsed mode the series should have the name, total number of volumes and the name of the last volume.

It would be nice to have a combined list of volume numbers, like "1-3,6-34" which would instantly show that I still need to find volumes 4,5 and 35+. But I understand it is not the easiest task if volume numbers are not exactly numbers (for example "collection 4,5,6"). But in such cases - the name of the last volume would suffice.

And of course, the expanded series will look like it does now.

title: Dutch translation
body: I added the Dutch (nl_NL) translation. CDATA not (yet) translated.

title: help transfer database as files
body:
I had to get a replacement Android phone.  I made a backup of my old "bookCatalogue" directory onto my main computer.  Once the Book Catalogue app was installed on the new phone, I copied the directory contents onto the new phone, but the old data is not seen.  It still thinks I have 0 books.

I used Windows Explorer to move the files, both off of the old phone and onto the new phone.  The phones were both LG Esteems running Android version 2.3.4.  The new phone is using version 5.0.8 of Book Catalogue.  I am not sure what version the old phone had.  It was downloaded approx Jan.2012, and would have been updated if the phone was informed of new versions.

Thank you for any help.

title: Changing default bookshelf?
body: How can I change the default startup bookshelf to one I've created? I've got a bookshelf of mine, one for family, another for a friend. I'd like the program to start in mine so when I add a new book it goes in to mine without having to move the book.

title: Fit/finish - wrong heading for add book by title/author (search internet)

body: Adding a book by title and author (search internet) has the heading of ISBN search.

title: Feature Request:  long press Artist menu item.
label: [Label(name="In Beta"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Soon(tm)"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body: Currently the long press menu for authors is just to edit the name.  Can you add a search the web link to this menu?

title: Sort by read/unread to support 'currently reading'
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
From a user:

> a feature that shows me which book I am currently reading (not only if it is read or not read). It would be so great if I could sort my books not only by bookshelves, but also by "read", unread" and "currently reading". With that feature, the app would be perfect!

Can probably be simply implemented by sorting based on 'Started Reading Date' then 'Finished Reading Date', in a manner so that books with no 'finished' date appear first in the list.

Or...have three headings 'Current'/'Unread'/'Read', where 'Current' is defined as 'Finished' NULL or 'Finished' before 'Current' (ie. re-reading)

title: Search issues
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
Via email

"When I search on "eye" I get one result only: one title that starts with the word "Eye."  But I have another book with "Eyes" in the middle of the title.  That second book doesn't show up unless I add the "s" and then hit search.  It would be preferable to have all books appear that have the string "eye" anywhere in the title."

title: Display Anthology Titles in Read-only view
body: (if present).

title: Convert ISBN10 to ISBN13
body:
I have a lot of old books that I bought in the 80's and such.  They have ISBN-10 on them and your program doesn't convert.  This feature would be very handy.  

There are a number of web converters out there, maybe a call to one of them when the bar code comes up with 10 instead of 13 digits?

title: "xxxx" is not a valid ISBN error
body: So, I've been looking for a long time for a book cataloging app to keep track of the books I have so I don't have to question which books I own. Most of the previous ones were terrible and I was really excited for this one... until I started using it. The first few books went great. They scanned and captured and got put on the bookshelf just fine. But after about 10, I ran into a problem. The scanner did not work. It would scan it and capture the barcode number - which is different than the ISBN - and tell me that it is not a valid ISBN. I tried using different scanners (Google Glasses, Zxing, pic2shop), turning off autofocus, everything I could think of with NO results. This is extremely frustrating. What can I do to avoid having to type every single ISBN in? I have way too many books to be doing that.

title: Workflow improvement: Eliminate double notification of duplicate book
body: I noticed when scanning my bookshelves that if I hit a duplicate book - yes, I sometimes have two copies of a book - and said to the first dialog "yes, continue" I eventually got a second dialog that I also had to confirm.  (I think the second one came after the "save book" button.)  It would be nicer if in this case (yes, I want to keep the duplicate) I only had to confirm it once.

title: Feature request: go direct from ISBN input activity to scan activity, and vice versa
body:
This is a workflow improvement request: To add the ability to move directly from the ISBN input activity to the ISBN scan activity, via a button.  And vice versa, though that would likely be harder to implement as ZXing or some other scanner owns that activity.

I discovered while scanning my bookshelves that most of my books had barcodes - but some didn't.  I could scan one after another, but when I uncovered a book in the stack that didn't have a barcode I had to switch via back-menutouch-selecttouch to the ISBN keyboard activity.  And then back again the same way.  3 touches (and delays for activities to load, which was painful for the book list) instead of one simple touch.

title: Feature request: author name normalization
body:
(This is my first issue ever submitted to github: I'mnot sure how to properly format it, sorry!)

This is a feature request: provide an author name normalization module.  This would handle a bunch of things including:  a) handling periods and spaces after abbreviations (e.g., W.W. Sawyer == W. W. Sawyer == W W Sawyer), b) middle name represented as initial vs middle name as full name, c) strange or inconsistent formattings of names that include tick marks - e.g., Russian names, d) handle badly formatted author names, e.g., those that include a title (e.g., Ph.D.) or a suffix (Jr), e) a blacklist for things that are not names entered in the author field (e.g., I have multiple books that have the authors "Mathematics" and "Physics"), and f) etc. etc.

There would be three goals: a) eliminate duplicate variant spellings of name for a single book (which I see quite a lot), b) correctly mark multiple books by same author when names are spelled differently, and c) provide a canonical formatting of author names (e.g., either with or without periods and spaces after initials, either using full middle names or only initials, etc.).

[Implementation note: much of the above can be handled on the device with some kinds of rules for text processing - which unfortunately may be language dependent! - but a possible way to see if two books are written by the same author when the names are spelled differently might be to data mine from some web site or web service, e.g., look at Amazon author pages ...]

title: Book Catalogue gets stuck searching Google Books
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="In Beta")]
body:
When adding a new book by ISBN, Book Catalogue searches a couple of different sources for more information about the book. As of last week, I seem to get stuck searching for the book on Google Books. The search message is stuck on the screen for 5+ minutes. Cancelling the search takes over one minute as well.
Looking at the relevant code in Book Catalogue, it seems like the URL being queried in that case is http://books.google.com/books/feeds/volumes?q=ISBN:<ISBN>
If I try that request manually, e.g. for http://books.google.com/books/feeds/volumes?q=ISBN:9780061020681 I seem to get more than one record back. Could that be the reason for this issue?

title: List of Awards (and books with them)
label: [Label(name="On Hold"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
From a user:

> it would be nice to have a list of awarded books for a better survey

None of our data sources currently support this, but it would be nice to have something like an 'Awards' style category, possibly with a new field for 'Date Awarded'...on hold for now.

title: Proposal: Allow barcode scanner to run before checking for internet connection
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
From email
"I added some books to the library and went to the shop.

I planned to look for some books and check if I had those by scanning the ISBN bar code but I couldn't because I had no internet access.

Is there a possibility to add an option to check if a book is already present in the library even without internet access just by scanning the bar code as you do to add a book ?"

Maybe have a popup that asks; "you have no internet connection, do you want to continue?"

title: Scanner does not work
body:
On ASUS TF300 tablet, using Android 4.2.1
I'd like to use Book-Catalogue, but the scanner does not work.

Trying to scan a book, a window appears with Google in the upper left, and a circle with flashing dots. This scanner does not read bar style [not dot style] ISBN codes from the back of books.

Is there a problem with some setting that I need to change, or is the wrong scanner being launched? The Goodreads app does provide a scanner that does work, but it shows a red line across the bar code rather than a circle with flashing dots.

Thanks,
ww

title: Request - "No of Copies" field
body:
Would it be possible to add a field for number of copies? I'm a teacher and have multiple copies of some books so that would be really helpful. 

Thank you for a very nice app!

When returning from bookshelf dialog, need to save details in the master data copy.

NB: should confirm that data is saved for other dialogs (series & authors).

title: Organizing Bookcatalogue folder
body:
Hi Philip, Evan, 

It might requires some search to find a specific file in the Book catalog folder. 
Reading the Bookshelf icon request, I said to myself "oh no" some extra files to mix with the one already existing. Would it not be possible to work with a subfolder structure looking more or less like this
BookCatalogue

  <dt>/DB</dt>

  <dt>/Icons</dt>
  <dd>Could hold the bookshelves icons</dd>
</dl>

title: Idea: Associate Icon with a bookshelf
body:
### Purpose

This is intended as a tool for users to gain greater visual meaning from book lists.
### The basic idea is
- a book shelf can have an optional icon associated with it
- if a bookshelf has an icon, then when the user selects the 'Show Bookshelves' option in the list 'extras', it will show the icon instead of the name (or as well)

Possible uses include:
- 'To Buy' shelf associate with the '$' icon; gives the user an immediate signal that they do not own this book
- 'To Read' shelf associate with an icon depicting a book (or something like that)
- 'Reference' shelf associate with a 'Library' icon (or something like that)'
- 'Whodunnit' shelf associated with a magnifying glass icon
### Discussion

These are just examples of what a user might choose to do. To make it work, we could need a fairly decent collection of icons as well as (_maybe_) the ability for users to add their own.

title: Genres
body: Would be better to allow a Genre list that you can maintain (like the Series formats).  There is a lot of inconsistency with Genre names as you read these in from amazon/google sources.

title: Manage Bookshelves
body: I seem to have about 4 blank bookshelves.  I can change the names, but cannot delete a bookshelf once created.

title: Allow users to link e-books to files
label: [Label(name="Analysis"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
From a user:

>  In the book details there should be box. While editing, clicking on it should prompt the user to go to the location of the ebook on the device, and this address/location should get entered in the info about the book. Then there should be a button saying open the book, it should simply open the file and use the default favorite app as set by the owner for the type of file (that will depend whether it is PDF, ePUB, MOBI or whatever format) to actually open it outside the Book Catalogue.

In the absence of a standard reader API, this _might_ be a good first step.

The key problem with this is:
- most epub files on Kindle have garbled names (may be true for others)
- many readers insist on storing the epubs in their own directory, so it is not clear which location to use
- it cries our for the next and most obvious step which would be to scan for ePubs, but they are almost invariably impossible to read and I forsee many annoyed users asking for this

title: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: setSpan
label: [Label(name="Analysis"), Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="On Hold")]
body:
Looks like an Android bug. User response was:

> I haven't been able to replicate it, as it occurred right as I was picking an alternative transcription of an ISBN I entered via Voice Recognition (Highly recommended for entering numbers without barcodes!). I accessed that by pressing the mic button in SwiftKey.
> Hasn't happened since, seems like a once off kind of thing.

It probably relates to the alternate input method.

title: Update strings.xml
body:
Hi Philip,

I've made some updates on existing strings. This can wait the next transation needs.

Thanks and have a nice day,
Patrice

title: Work in progress for incremental import/backup
java.lang.RuntimeException: Failure delivering result
label: [Label(name="Analysis"), Label(name="Defect")]
body:
Crash in TextViewAccessor, after editing Series.

I suspect this results from onActivityResult() being called before onResume(), but need to check code carefully.

USER_COMMENT=Good afternoon from Italy! This happened while just scanning in yet another book in my collection of 200+ books, and had never happened before in approx. 3 weeks of use. I realise this won't probably be of great help, but I can't provide better details, sorry!
By the way, if you need help improving the Italian translation, I would be very glad to contribute. Just let me know.

__book_id->6114352
description->Kätzchen sind unwiderstehlich: Mit ihren tapsigen Bewegungen, großen Augen und dem flauschigen Fell erobern sie unsere Herzen im Sturm. Die Autorin Brigitte Eilert-Overbeck liefert in diesem Ratgeber das Basiswissen über die richtige Haltung, Beschäftigung und Gesunderhaltung von Kätzchen. Das geballte Praxiswissen der Autorin und eine Fülle an Tipps und Ideen machen das Buch zu einem unverzichtbaren Ratgeber für jeden Katzenfreund. Tolle Sonderseiten vermitteln das Wissen auf attraktive Weise, so hilft z. B. der "Verhaltensdolmetscher" bei der Kommunikation mit dem Tier. "Auf einen Blick" erklärt in Wort und Bild die Sinnesleistungen des Tieres. Unter "Tut gut - besser nicht!" erfahren Sie, auf was es in den ersten Tagen mit dem neuen Hausbewohner ankommt. Und die 10 GU-Erfolgstipps fassen die Informationen am Ende des Buches prägnant zusammen. Haben Sie nach der Lektüre noch Fragen? Dann schreiben Sie an den Verlag. Dank GU Experten-Service haben Sie den direkten Draht zum Fachmann.

title: android.view.WindowManager$BadTokenException: Unable to add window -- token android.os.BinderProxy@406a0740 is not valid; is your activity running?
label: [Label(name="Analysis"), Label(name="Defect")]
body:
Caused by the old-style dialog mechanic that relied on a specific background context existing when the network activity completes.

By using fragments, fragment tasks etc, these should be removed.

Need to check if we can bypass this problem for all network-related dialogs.

title: java.lang.NullPointerException at com.eleybourn.bookcatalogue.Fields$EditTextAccessor.set(Fields.java:429)
label: [Label(name="Analysis"), Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="In Beta")]
body:
Seeing crashes like this on Android 4.1.1 (and, as of July 2013, on 4.0.4 and 4.3). Version 5.0.8 adds more debugging to analyze.

Probably relates to the really buggy EditText/TextView implementation in 4.1 and 4.1.1, but would be nice to develop a work-around.

See this comment https://github.com/eleybourn/Book-Catalogue/issues/505#issuecomment-25216775 for a description of how to reproduce, though it does not work for me in 4.0.3 (HTC) or 4.3 (Nexus).

title: Update strings.xml
body:
Hi Philip,

Translations are done. I will maybe change them once I will see them in their context but so far I think it's ok.

Have a nice week-end, 
Patrice

title: Simplfy the entry of repetative things; bookshelves, locations, authors, publishers, series, etc by presenting a drop-down of known entries and an option to add a new entry.
body:
I had this thought while starting into a large stack of Time Life books, repetively attempting to type the same series name in, the exact same way for each. It would be nice if instead one could chose from a list of known Series entries and still have the ablity to type in a new entry if need be.

This is same concept could be applied to improve data entry speed and accuracy in other areas, as well; bookshelves as stated above, locations (I tend to use bookshelves because they are simpler to use and more functional, right now), authors, publishers, etc.

Love the app, it is already making a tedious job much easier. Just asking for a bit of polish now.

[EDITED moments after posting the above suggestion.]

I'm sorry, I see now, once I started to type the series there was a list of suggestions from previous entries. A hidden feature.

title: Add the ability to create a new bookshelf, in the bookshelf selection dialog.
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
I never seem to realize that I need a new bookshelf, until I am just about done adding a new book. At which point, I then have to go to the main menu, manage bookshelfs, create the new bookshelf, back to the main menu, view the list of books, find the book I just added (likely having to change the shelf I was looking at), view the book, edit the book, change the bookshelf, save and move on with my life. 

It would be nice if one could add a new bookshelf when selecting the bookshelf for a book.

title: Add editing to the read-only screen!
label: [Label(name="Analysis"), Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
From a user:

> Now that you have different display modes, could you make it so that the star rating and the "read it" check box can be accessed without going into the edit mode?

It does not seem too unreasonable to allow limited changes, eg,

One possibility is:
- long-click on any field brings up a unique field-specific editor. eg. long-click on 'rating' or 'read' would bring up a small
  dialog with:
  - read checkbox
  - date started
  - date finished
  - rating

(ie. all four appear no matter which of the four you clicked)

The same could be done for 'description', author/title, series, publication details etc

Or we could have a specific menu item for a very limited set of features.

Not sure best way to proceed.

We DO NOT want to break the clean look of the read-only screen.

title: Update strings.xml
body:
HI Philip,

Here the adapted file though I'm not sure these are ok. I would like to see them in real to confirm those translations.

Imkal

title: Update strings.xml
body:
Hi, 

Translation of "Language" into "Langage" and translation of the "What's new" section.

Thanks and have a nice day,
Imkal

title: Autofill date finished reading
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
Next, i think it would be great to have an option available that would fill in the "date finished reading" when you check the "I've read this book" box.

Via email from Darrell

title: Some covers are not synced through Goodreads
body:
When I add new books to my library and afterwards sync the library with Goodreads, most of the covers that have been found on my device are synced to Goodreads (but not all). When I then sync Goodreads to my other device roughly half of the covers are not synced at all.
Any reason for that?
Another idea would be to update the cover for a book if not present from the internet (by searching the book and then downloading the cover).

title: Code cleanup
body:
Trying to use one source for data fields (but preserve legacy code),
the new Language field has been moved over to the DatabaseDefinitions
mode of doing things.

title: Yet Another Field: Lexile value
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Field"), Label(name="On Hold"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
From a user:

> I am a teacher and I use your app in my classroom every day! I love having an easy way to loan books from my classroom library. In education, Lexile scores are used to determine what books are appropriately challenging for a given student. Every book gets a lexile score. I would love to be able to search my library by lexile score!

title: Update from internet support for Language
Export support
body: csv export to support language

title: Language field added
body:
- Database changes (CatalogueDBAdapter)
- UI/XML changes to add 'Language' field (edit_book.xml,
  book_details.xml & strings.xml)
- added to BookDetailsAbstract to ensure displayed/saved
- added to arrays in FieldVisibility.java
- shown or hidden in BookEditFragmentAbstract

title: Add the ability to highlight books on specific shelves
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
From a user:

> What about one bookshelf only that gets color coded (red?) everywhere in the system, whatever display you have. I am, for instance, displaying All Books by author and then series but it is all collapsed. Background is dark bookshelves and the text is white. I would like to see that text in RED! if any book under an author is in that specific bookshelf; for me it could be books to buy, for someone else books to read for an exam, etc.

I'm not too keen on big blocks of bright colours, but something like:

![Screenshot_2013-02-13-10-26-46-mockup-of-colour-markup](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/566938/199032/8d08bc58-806e-11e2-9e76-ece195e60c75.jpg)

could be useful.

This makes sense in the context that shelves are really just 'keywords' associate with books. Inevitably we would get requests for colours for multiple shelves, but see a book is in my "To Buy" or "To Read" list might be nice.

title: 4 new fields
label: [Label(name="Field"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
Hello, 

I like this application, but I wish that I could manually add fields. 

I would like to track the value of my collection for insurance purposes. You have the list price field. Can you add a value field too? I would like to then see a total of all the value fields. 

Also, the signed checkbox is nice. How about a field for edition and printing? For example, my copy may be a first edition, but a second printing. Or even better, a first/first. 

I would also like a field for the number of a limited series. For example, I may have copy 171 of a 500 copy limited edition run. 

I work at NVIDIA and am about to do an article on book tracking on Tegra devices for our website. I would like to use your application in the article. Having these extra additions would really help. 

Thanks, 
Sean

title: default bookshelf for a new entry not saved in 5.0.0
body:
In 4.x when I add I book, the current bookshelf is selected as bookshelf. If I started in "All books", the "default"-bookshelf was selected.

In 5.0.0, the current bookshelf is listed for the new book, but when you click it, it is not really selected. If you save the book, without clicking the bookshelf and manually selecting one, it is saved without any bookshelf, what makes it really hard to find...

title: Update res/values-fr/strings.xml
body:
Hi Grunthos, Philip,

I've corrected some spelling errors and changed some phrases that were not that good French when reading them through the application. 

Nothing really important just some improvements.

Thanks and have a nice day,
Patrice

title: All authors expanded when My Books first opened, not remembered after first book is viewed
body:
When you go to the root page (I.e. the one with help), then click My Books, all authors are always expanded. If one then clicks on a book, and goes back to My Books, only the book you clicked on (and any you previously clicked on) are then shown expanded. This can be repeated without closing the app.

Not a big problem, just inconsistent. I'd prefer that they all remain expanded until the user manually collapses them or uses the menu to do likewise. Presumably the issue is just that the saved expanded/collapsed state isn't used when My Books is first opened.

Version  5.0.1

title: Update res/values-fr/strings.xml
body:
Hi Philip,

After a view in the application, I made some translations shorter. I also added some I missed sending you though I had translated them. I based my final file on your comments and those hadn't any. No big deal, it can wait the next release.

title: Allow the user to save a default "Read" status (and others)
body:
Request from a user:

> Given a lot of people may be beginning to catalogue a large collection it would be useful to be able to set the “Read this Book” value to default to “Yes”.  A Y/N option in preferences.  In my case I have some thousands of books acquired since the late 60’s so saving thousands of keystrokes on this old wrist would help.   I rather suspect there is a significant match between people with a lot of paper books and people with ageing wrists ;->

We probably need to have a single pass in which we do:
- default format
- default 'read' status
- default bookshelves 
- default location

Some or all of these might be better just using the last setting.

Comments welcome!

title: Optional 'Hard' link for goodreads 'read' shelf
body:
Currently we use the the goodreads 'read' shelf to set the 'read' flag on first import only. Goodreads uses exclusive shelves (can not be on 'read' and 'to-read' or 'currently-reading') which is incompatible with our system of shelves.

The following request was received from a user:

> If syncing with Goodreads, it would be nice to see an option to link the Goodreads "Read" bookshelf and the "Have you read this book field?" Another option is to disable the "Have you read this book?" and have the green tick show if a book is in "Read" bookshelf, no matter which bookshelf is being used.

Which would, more or less, require we implement shelves with special meaning. It's an interesting idea that needs more analysis, though I largely hate the 'exclusive' shelves model of goodreads.

title: Merge russian xlations
body: Russian xlations

title: Allow user-configuable path for covers
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
With the advent of more recent phones 'external storage' is no longer external.

We probably need to allow for user-configurable storage locations instead of the hardcoded one we do now.

From a user:

> Actually all the covers are going to my phone for some reason. When I
> found the files they were on my phone. I plugged in to my computer, copied
> them to my computer then had to copy them all to the new phone. They
> wouldn't work until they were copied to the PHONE not the sd card. I first
> copied them to the sd card and they wouldn't show. So I copied them to a
> file on my phone and then they showed.

title: When changing to a new phone I can't import my files . . . .
body: I have the files saved to my sd card.  I put the sd card into the new phone.  I import the file and when I import it says successful yet not one book shows up in the app??  What am I doing wrong?  I have 611 books scanned and or typed by hand in this program and REALLY DON'T want to do it again.  The old phone is still showing that all the books are in the app even without the sd card.  I don't know what to do!!  Can you help me please?!

title: Advanced search
body:
From a user:

> Could search give a pick-list of, say, All, Title, Author, Publisher, Description, so that, in my example, I would have limited it to titles and hit the correct answer immediately?

I can't see how to do this in the confines of the standard android search bar. Do we need an 'Advanced Search' dialog, or can we extend the android search bar?

title: Future Plans for Archives
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
# Some things for Backup/Restore in 5.x
## Incremental Backup

Use the last full archive date (or a 'requires_backup' flag) to select records to backup. Probably can't just use a date because an import may create 'new' records with update dates in the past.

Possibly add a 'last_backup_date' to each book, or add a 'backup_history' table.

This needs to be thought through carefully to allow for:
- simple updates
- updates via import
- importing your own backups
- importing someone else's full or partial backup
### Suggested Implementation

DO NOT USE LAST_BACKUP_DATE method; this means every backup would update every book!

Add a new field 'instance_update_date' to books; this will be set to 'current time' on EVERY update or insert. This is distinct from 'update_date' which, in an import, will be set to the value store in the archive or CSV file.

Compare 'instance_update_date' to the last backup date stored in preferences, and use this to derive the list of books.
- simple updates WORKS (all updates will be backed up)
- updates via import WORKS (all imported records need to be backed up)
- importing your own backups WORKS (all imported records need to be backed up)
- importing someone else's full or partial backup WORKS 

The only real downside above is that after restoring a full backup on an empty database, the system will want you to perform a backup...
### Further analysis required....

I started to implement this on 5.0 sources; unfortunately, the way our export currently runs, if one changes the name of an author, one needs to mark all books referring to that author as dirty. Ditto renaming shelves and series.

It means that renaming one shelf could result in hundreds of books being included in the next incremental backup. Similarly, renaming a series affects all books in the series.

This may be good, but some clarity of thought (and analysis) is required.
## Partial restore

Only update books/covers if newer record is found archive.

Implementation is easy: just get the update_date from the book record in the archive and compare it to the database record for the book, if it exists.
## Destructive Restore
### Suggested implementation:

Use the 'instance_update_date' from above.

Perform an 'import' then delete any book that does not have a 'instance_update_date' at or after the restoration job started. More safely:
- at start of job, get max('instance_update_date') from database
- perform import
- delete all books with 'instance_update_date' <= max value retrieved at start

If you really want to be paranoid, before doing the delete, make sure count of books with 'instance_update_date' > max value == number of books imported.
### Original plan:

Keep track of which UUIDs are added during a restore (create 'restored_uuids' table for this pupose and clear it before a restore).

Any book or cover with a UUID not in the table after the restore will be deleted.

This is probably the simplest method of a more traditional restore; the prospect of recreating the database and somehow swapping the active database at runtime is not appealing.
## User-selectable classes to backup/restore

Allow the user to select some or all of the possible classes to backup/restore. Classes include:
- books
- covers
- styles
- preferences

It's probably not unreasonable to just restore settings and/or styles, for example.

It's also nice to backup without covers because the file is soooo much smaller.
## Automatic warning

Simple implementation:

get last backup date from prefs then 

```
select count(*) from books where 'instance_update_date' >= [last backup date]
```

if > 0, warn user...

Once we have the ability to detect "unbacked-up changes", we can tailor our automatic backup message to appear only when necessary and to tell the user what is missing.

title: Suffixed in names not handled well. eg "William F. Buckley, Jr"
body:
From a user:

> I have an author - William F. Buckley, Jr. - that was displayed under Jr., William F. Buckley.  (I have Family names first).  I edited it to have Buckley as the family name, but it would be nice to have the Jr. recognized as a suffix instead of the family name. 

See https://github.com/eleybourn/Book-Catalogue/issues/418 for a possible solution.

To fix this automatically would require a list of known suffixes, possibly in multiple languages.

title: When searching by ASIN, use title/author (or ISBN) in subsequent searches
label: [Label(name="In Beta")]
body: Currently it just searches Amazon, and this seems inferior

title: Preference to always show a specific book style in "My Books"
body:
From a user:

> When the list of books opens, it’s always author and books showing. For mom (and maybe others) setting a preference to only list authors would work better. It makes it easier to scroll down until she finds the author, then open that author’s list.

To do this we would probably need to add 'Always Expanded/Collapsed' to the settings in a user style.

title: option to classify as ebook?
body: I am using this to sync to good reads but also to track my books for insurance should there ever be a fire/flood/robbery. It would be helpful to distinguish which are hardcopy and which are ebook.

title: Add sort_by 'bookshelves' option
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Soon(tm)"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
Treat it like series or author (ie. use primary or use all). I tend to use bookshelves as 'keywords', so seeing a list of all books based on this sort order (or seeing which of my sci-fi books are also under 'mystery') is very appealing.

Great idea from a user.

title: attempt to acquire a reference on a close SQLiteClosable
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="In Beta")]
body:
This looks like a manifestation of a known Android problem:

```
https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=4282
http://darutk-oboegaki.blogspot.com.au/2011/03/sqlitedatabase-is-closed-automatically.html
```

and a work-around is in my current sources

title: Inconsistency in Series change window
body: When I enter a new series for a book there are 2 field - series name and series number, the number is optional. When I click on the number field to enter some number I get the correct keyboard for entering only numbers 0-9. This is correct. If however I have already added a series for a book, but have not assigned a number yet and go into the book, click on the series to edit it a new small dialog is opened with the series name field and series number field. When click in the number field the keyboard is the standard one for entering text, when I expect again the numbers-only keyboard. This is incorrect.

title: Read only mode for book details
body:
What is done:
 1) Read-only option on 'Other preferences' (by default it is disabled)
 2) Creating base abstract class with common code for both edit and read-only mode of book details. BookEditFields and BookDetailsReadOnly are descendants of it now.
 3) Implementing zooming by default on clicking on book thumbnail in bookdetails (both in read-only and edit mode).

title: Read only mode for book details screen
body:
It`s disabled by default. 
Option in 'Other preferences' has been added.
Editing of the book through the options or context menu after enabling.

title: When entering title every word starts with uppercase by default
body: Please add option to disable this for the title field in the settings menu. I am using the app for non-english (cyrillic) works and in my language it is incorrect to type every word with uppercase. It is too much trouble to disable uppercase after every white-space.

title: Search is not case insensitive
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="In Beta")]
body: Searching only works if you type exactly the author or title name. Please make the search upper/lower case insensitive.

title: Implementing read-only mode for book details
body:
1)  Read-only option on 'Other preferences' (by default it is disabled)
2) Creating base abstract class with common code for both edit and read-only mode of book details. BookEditFields and BookDetailsReadOnly are descendants of it now.
3) Implementing zooming by default on clicking on book thumbnail in bookdetails (both in read-only and edit mode)

title: Add 'role' to authors
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
Allow a user to specify the role for each 'author' of a book. This would include (but not be limited to):
- author
- editor
- translator
- reader
- illustrator
- foreword
- introduction

etc etc.

This would require manual maintenance, and data from internet would assume all were 'authors'.

title: Marketplace info
body: Russian translation and moving to appropriate folder

title: Add a sort_value for many text fields
body:
Not really a big fan of this one, mainly because it adds so much work (and duplication):

It is worth pondering, however. And documenting.

From a user:

> Sorting order: The Scandinavian languages have 3 letters more than English. They are å, ä and ö and are at the very end of the alphabet. German sorting mixes these letters in with the As and the Os as to Germans they are the same letter with a changed sound, i.e. umlaut. Sorry, this is about diacritics, but sorting, not searching. Here is a suggestion from way back: "When the program detects any diacritic in a sortable field it should open up a check box (like the new ASIN) asking if the diacritic should be used in sorting or ignored. The user clicks YES if Swedish, etc. but ignores the check box if French, Spanish, German, etc."

Ths suggestion would work, but necessitates storing two copies of every sortable string. This would include:
- author
- title
- publisher
- format
- others?

My preference is to wait for the ability to associate a locale with every string. Then I will probably buy my ski tickets for hell. Just saying.

title: Reorganize cover menu to reflect common usage
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
From user;

> Cover pictures: After long press on cover, split the second line to
>   Replace Thumbnail Camera...
>   Replace Thumbnail Other...

Seems sensible to me.

title: Option to 'Lock Rotation'
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
From user:

> A preference to lock rotation when entering the program, and unlock when exiting....if I forget, a picture might  be rotated.

Seems like it should be simple, just need to know the simplest method,

title: Save prefereneces on Export
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="In Beta"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
From user:

> Save all preferences to the SD card, including LibraryThing, etc. in the same folder as the books. Then no problem un-, re-installing or moving to a new phone. Best example I know of this is PimlicalA.

This seems _very_ sensible.

Should include custom styles as well.

Probably do it as part of 'archive' implementation, but may want to do it before

title: Help track books that the user has *borrowed*
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
From a user:

> For the borrowed books, I think it would need just two things - a borrowed from field (contact field) and a due date.  Linking to the calendar would be best, but not necessary.  It could be on the same loan tab you have now - in fact, you could have a toggle for lent to/borrowed from, keep the existing contact field, and add a due date.

Relatively simple idea that also links to another request to add a 'due date' to the lending feature.

title: Editing style grouping resets style details
label: [Label(name="Defect")]
body:
Since 4.0...
- Edit/clone a style
- make some changes
- click 'Edit' on 'Groupings'
- click 'Cancel'

Edit of style will have been lost.

title: Text wrapping on the main screen
body:
Could we move Donate or Help button to the separate item, because on some screens Donate text is wrapped? For example Donate in Russian and Help in Czech.

Screenshot:
http://screencast.com/t/uCqxxvO77c

title: More complete 'Loaned' view
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
From a user:

> I think I read something about a reminder for lended books. Did I? Or was it another app I finally abandoned? ;-) Anyway, a monthly reminder "Philip still has Harry Potter 1 since 12-May-2012" would be an improvement - also to attract new users.

My thinking:

The main obstacle is that in order for us to send reminders, we need to
have access to the contacts list, and people get _really_ gnarly about
that (understandably so).

So, how about, as a very broad spec:
- _if_ you load a book to anyone, you get a 'Books on Loan' entry in the
  main screen.
- 'books on loan' is arranged as:
  'Overdue'
      n Years
          <person>
              ....whatever you choose in style...defaults to Author then title...
          <person>
              ...
      n Months
          ....
      n Days
          ...
  
  'On Loan'
      <person>
          ....
      <person>
          ....

title: (Somehow) link 'read' books to a 'read' shelf
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
This was a suggestion from a user based on goodreads experience.

This seems like a good general feature to add.

It's not clear how best to implement it.

**Option 1 is:**
- allow the user the option of specifying a single shelf (with any name) as their 'read' shelf. This wuold be a checkbox on the 'edit shelf' activity.
- only one shelf can be a 'read' shelf.
- adding a book to this shelf marks the book as 'read'
- removing a book from this shelf clears the 'read' flag on the book
- setting the 'read' flag on a book puts it on this shelf
- clearing the 'read' flag on a book removes it from this shelf
- import from goodreads 'read' shelf updates the nominated 'read' shelf, not the one named 'read'. Similar on send to goodreads.
- on upgrade, offer the user the option to select a shelf to be their 'read' shelf.

This can _probably_ be all done with triggers, except it involves recursion (though does not need it), so may break in early android. Careful testing would be needed.

**Option 2 is:**

Virtual 'read' and 'unread' shelves. Would need:
- preference for virtual shelf names; would default to localized version of 'Read' and 'Unread'
- upgrade would rename existing shelf with same name
- code to prevent a shelf with that name being created/renamed
- selecting the 'read' shelf would limit queries to only 'read' books, but with no actual shelf to filter. Similar for 'Unread'
- import from goodreads would only set 'read' flag; no read/unread shelves would be created

**In all options:**
- export would export the 'read' shelf as a normal shelf, redundant but clear

**Preferred Solution**

Option 2 at this stage.

Comments welcome!

title: Test if can be merged. DO NOT ACTION THIS!
'Book already exists' message only displayed if book has isbn
body:
Reported by user. As title says. 

We currently report when ISBN is scanned and when they click the 'Add' button.

It may be worth adding another check just before we go to the 'Add Book' activity _IF_ the books does not have an ISBN.

It may also be valuable to do the check in all cases.

ie. warn that, even though the ISBN is not in the library, the same Author/Title is.

While this latter part is very similar to another suggestion, the basic issue remains a bug.

title: Some punctuation and diacritical marks cause problems in searc
label: [Label(name="Defect")]
body:
Not sure if it's our problem or Amazon, or both. But two searches that seem reasonable fail:
1. Search for title "Gulliver's Travels" (note the apostrophe)
2. Search for anything by the author "Giuseppe Tomasí di Lampedusa" (note the 'í')

Neither finds any books.

The first works if the apostrophe is removed and the second works if the 'í' is replaced with an 'i'.

title: Full translation into Russian
body: All strings completely have been translated into Russian

title: Add year and/or publisher to search.
body:
Request from user.

Not sure which of our search providers (if any) would support his.

We could implement it as part of the [result list code (Issue 284)](https://github.com/eleybourn/Book-Catalogue/issues/284) to post-filter the lists.

title: (optionally) Link styles with bookshelves
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
From a user:

> I would find it great to have the presentation option linked with library. when looking at all books I like the author/series pesentation while looking at my anthologies, I prefer the Series and while looking at the Read library the read date presentatin is the best one.

I really like this idea. 'Books on Loan' sorted by 'Due Date' leaps out at me.

Of course it would be optional.

When in one view, changing the shelf would apply the 'shelf-style' if defined, otherwise preserve the current style.

title: android.database.CursorIndexOutOfBoundsException: Index 0 requested, with a size of 0
label: [Label(name="Analysis"), Label(name="Defect")]
body:
Initial inspection suggests this is occurring during scrolling and inside the Android code to reuse views. First it checks the 'current' row item type, in this case the current row is 0...and the item type depends on the cursor...and the cursor has no rows. Which is very odd.

This occurred when the user was browsing books...and it is hard to imagine reasons for the cursor to be empty.

Best contenders are:
- screen is being rotated and cursor was closed
- list is being regenerated _and_ scrolled at the same time...somehow!

Have asked user for more details

Edit: More details:

> I just can't tell you how it happened. I was looking at a book and
> maybe was coming back to the list but I'm not even sure. In fact, I
> put my Gsm aside whle checking Goodreads and it's when I took it back
> that I saw the error message.

and 

> Yes it went to sleep.

title: Counter-intuitive UI when editing assignment to bookshelf
body:
In the "edit book" dialogue it is not obvious how to change the assignment of a book between one or several bookshelves. Example: initially a book is assigned to bookshelf "Reading". When I click on the button "select bookshelves", all my bookshelves appear, none of which is checked. Not even the "Reading bookshelf". When I now select "Read" and ok, the book is now assigned to two shelves, read and reading. The only way I can unassign from Reading is to stay in the select bookshelves, select "reading", ok, than go back in "select bookshelves" (now the "reading" is active), unselect "reading" again. ok and save. Or something like that. I'm not saying it is impossible, it is however pretty fiddly.

My guess is that by design all the checkboxes should be marked when an assignment exists, and should be editable in that way.

A side-effect of the above behaviour is that you can also have a book assigned to one bookshelf more than once, at least in the "edit book" screen. But that could be just an update flaw, not that important. I also wonder if it makes sense that there seems to be a default assignment to the last bookshelf used by a previous edit once you add a new book, but also that would not be a problem, if the editing of the assignment would be more obvious.

title: Add a "list duplicates" button
body:
Adding this as a reminder to myself for something I wish to add, though it might also be useful for other people.

I would occasionally find it useful to be able to produce a list of duplicate books, e.g. if like me you have some duplicates due to adding collections together, or accidental buys (pre-Book-Catalogue ;)), it would be useful to know which you can give away, etc.

I know this could be done at the time they are added to the database, but this may not be convenient (e.g. if some books are in storage and you wish to select the best copy to keep, etc.)

title: Current bookshelf not ticked when using Select Bookshelves button
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="In Beta")]
body:
When adding or editing a book entry, if one clicks on the Select Bookshelves button the currently selected bookshelf is not shown with a tick.

Therefore to change the bookshelf one must tick and untick the current shelf, then tick the new one.

Version 4.1.2

title: Give option to have "standard" numerical ISBN keypad in landscape mode
body:
For want of a better barcode scanner I use ZXing. Unfortunately this only operates in landscape mode so I'm then forced to use the landscape ISBN keyboard (well not forced, but you know what I mean).

This keyboard layout is rather unintuitive for me, though I understand the reasoning as it uses more space than the portrait one would in landscape mode. Nevertheless, I'd find it easier to tap in numbers on a smaller but standard layout numeric keypad and I imagine I'm not the only one.

title: Provide location of existing book when adding duplicate
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="On Hold"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
It would be useful to not only be told you're adding a duplicate but to also be told where it's located (i.e. Which bookshelf).

This would allow the user to check (e.g. Which copy is best, which to sell/give away; or has my wife/daughter/other moved an already scanned book so I'm now scanning it again).

title: Mark books as 'do not share' (aka. embarassing secrets)
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Soon(tm)"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
I have a small collection of books that...I'd prefer never made it to goodreads (eg. pretty much anything by Piers Anthony). Dreadful books, purchased in the dim distant past that are just embarrassing.

Would be nice to mark these as 'Do not share' or 'Do not share with goodreads'...or something like that.

I don't really want a separate 'do not share' flag for every provider we add, and I do not want to stop the recently improved 'share' functionaility.

My thinking is that the 'do not share' will just stop the book being shared in any bulk operation. If you click on 'Send this book to goodreads' or 'Share this book', it will still work.

And it will always be exported via the csv export.

title: Allow exports to be 'shared' and/or saved locally (as well as bookCatalogue directory)
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="In Beta"), Label(name="Soon(tm)"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
After running an export, we offer the user the ability to mail the file.

Would be nice to extend that to allow any form of sharing and/or saving to local/remote file systems. Hopefully the 'share' code will allow a file browser to save it.

Based on this comment:

https://github.com/eleybourn/Book-Catalogue/issues/380#issuecomment-9190515

title: Updated german l10n
body: Adds a few missing strings from the latest commits.

title: Importing an exported CSV that had new books added in same format does nothing
body:
Before I got my Android tablet I kept track of my hundreds of read books using Excel for each author. Now I have found the amazing "Book-Catalogue" app for Android. NOTE: I run the  "Book-Catalogue" app for Android direct from my SD card.
     I have converted a few authors of my pre Android reads to csv format as a test. I then exported all the "Book-Catalogue" ones read since using "Book-Catalogue" and copied the exported header over to my csv file. I then set up my csv file to match the exported version for the author, title,  added a  "1" in the read field, added dates in the same format to the read _end field, and left the id field blank.
      I then used the CMD function in DOS to copy both the the exported CSV and my limited csv file  to a new merged file. It looks fine. I did an Excel sort by the author to get them grouped for easier comparison between the old export and my csv file. I also deleted the second header row (from my little csv file).
   Then I renamed the new combined file with the same name as the original exported one and copied it to my Androids SD card in the same folder where the original exported file was (overwriting the previous version). When I remount the SD card & run "Book-Catalogue" and do an import the newly added books do NOT show up.
   Where have I gone wrong?

title: Sync to online storage to support users with multiple devices
label: [Label(name="Soon(tm)"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
It will need a last changed timestamp on all fields, but otherwise it should be fairly simple. (Don't bother syncing thumbnails at this point).

I have a server that could be used for this purpose.

label: [Label(name="In Beta")]

title: ASIN Keyboard
label: [Label(name="In Beta")]
body:
Hi...I'm having trouble adding books using ASIN instead of ISBN...the right letters don't show on the keyboard even after I check the ASIN button. Could you please help?

Via email

title: Anthology checkbox is not saving properly
body:
My issue - actually, it's more of a behavior that does not match the way it should work.  The "Anthologies Titles" tab of a book - when you check or uncheck the "All stories ..." box and then save the book - the state always reverts to what it was before a change to the check box.  So, by default for any new book added, the default state of the check box is ticked (green checkmark) and if I uncheck it, and then save the book, the check mark reverts to ticked and the green checkmark is still there and will continue to stay there no matter if I save the book or leave the app or anything.  It will just not save the new state of the check box.

By happy chance, I found that I CAN alter its state if I check or uncheck it, but DO NOT save the book, only use the backout key, going back to the bookshelf listing.  I see the listing shiver a bit so I can tell it is updating.  And lo and behold, it has saved the state of the Anthologies titles.  So it is saving when I backout, but not saving when I use save function.  You may want to document it if the fix is too awkward but it has a workaround, so no worries.

Via Email from Stacey

title: Integrate with Zxing scanner
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="On Hold"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body: Build Zxing into the app. This would reduce problems resulting from goggles, and allow app control from withing the scanner.

title: Restore?
body: My phone completely died last year and I apparently didn't quite know how the software works.  I didn't export the database.  I know that I need to do that now, but we've got so many books that putting them all in again seems such an overwhelming task.  I plugged in my phone today to sort through the files that are in the bookcatalogue file and found some entitled dbUpdate-57-58, and things like that.  When I opened them in notepad, I could make out some of the information from my old catalog.  Is there a way to restore my files using those dbUpdate files?

title: Barcode scan returning wrong book
body:

Entering 0586010807  Issac Asimov; Foundation; Foundation Saga; published by Granada/Panther and bought in 1988

Result: 9780765319197 Issac Asimov; The End of Eternity; Foundation Saga (1) et al
repeating gives
Result: 9780765319142 Issac Asimov; The Stars, Like Dust; Foundation (1) et al

Same Cover image for both search results but from a different edition of the correct book

title: Fix to Issue #341
body:
Clicking any field on BookEdit activity is considered a change, and the user is asked to confirm exiting without saving when back button is pressed.
If no field was clicked the confirmation dialog is not showed.

You've got a great app!
This is my first contribution, hope I can help!

title: Display externally sourced reviews of book being added (searched for)
body:
Another of those "standing in the bookshop" type requests ;)

It would be nice to be able to search for any given book (this would mean using the Add Book functionality currently) and to see not only the book synopsis but also a list of reviews so that I can decide whether the book is any good and worth buying.

Goodreads, Amazon and Google Books all provide reviews/ratings, so there ought to be sufficient data out there to make this useful. 

Deciding which to use might be more troublesome, but it should be possible to obtain the overall rating info for a given book from the 3 services and present that compactly (average stars & total number of reviews) and then allow the user to select whichever service they prefer (e.g. if it has the most reviews) to be expanded and have the book reviews downloaded while they wait.

title: Add Thumbnail ... from Camera does not work any more
body:
The picture is taken, and you get the accept screen, but in stead of returning to Book Catalogue, the camera software is displayed again.

You cannot do anything useful than pressing 'return' after which no thumbnail is displayed in the entry screen.

With 'Add Thumbnail ... from Gallery' I can choose the photo just taken, so the picture was taken.

title: Online database sync method
body:
As my wife and I share the same house and books (but not phone), it would be nice if we could also share the same book database and have it sync automatically without my needing to remember which phone I last scanned an item with, then backup, copy across, import, etc.

I imagine that Google Docs (spreadsheet) could be used to hold the online master record. One possibility would be to add a field to the database recording who/which phone/etc. added any given record and when (already there I think), which could then be compared with the last sync time to ensure the master record is correct.

I know syncing and conflict resolution can get quite complex, but hopefully this would not be overly so... ;)

title: Add field names to edit page text entry boxes
label: [Label(name="In Beta")]
body: When modifying a book which has been wrongly identified, it's often quite hard to work out which of the text entry fields is the author, title, publisher, etc. It would be useful for each text entry box to have a label describing its contents.

title: Add support for ISSN (periodicals)
label: [Label(name="Analysis"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
I have lots of National Geographic magazines (and lots of Autocars for that matter). It would be useful to be able to add them to the database. Worldcat.org should provide title info for a given ISSN (once extracted from an EAN), though with no date info, this would need to be manually added per scanned item to differentiate between issues.

Realistically I envision adding the records to the backup file on the PC (plus contents info which I'll need to webscrape), but just recognising these numbers would make the resultant data searchable.

I suppose one could potentially add custom plugins per-publication as part of the app to populate contents, but I don't know how complex a plugin infrastructure would be or whether there's enough demand to merit writting the framework.

On a slightly different note, what about music scores? Afair these have their own EAN "country" code, are they supported? I don't have any but was just wondering.

it would be fun to browse my history in chronological order...
```

title: Add ability to reset default barcode scanner
body:
If I set e.g. ZXing as the default barcode scanner (and I imagine most people set a default as otherwise the choice dialog window keeps popping up), the only way I can later change my mind is to remove that application (i.e., ZXing), run Book-Catalogue to be presented with the choice dialog again, then re-install ZXing.

Apparently some apps allow one to "Clear defaults" from the global "Settings > Applications > Manage Applications" list. Either supporting this (an xml change?) or adding an option to clear the default scanner inside the app itself would be useful.

title: Search using barcode scanner to acquire EAN/ISBN, "fuzzy" matching of returned book
body:
When I'm standing in a bookshop, it would be great to be able to scan a book barcode and be able to search the database for it using the decoded EAN/ISBN. If the book is present it could be displayed as per the manual input search, and if not perhaps the user could be given the option to add it to a bookshelf (e.g. I could then add it to a Wishlist bookshelf).

If this were implemented, it would also be useful to perform "fuzzy" matching of the book which matches the ISBN - by this I mean that I don't (necessarily) want to buy another copy of a book just because it has a different ISBN (e.g. hardback vs softback, different editions, US vs UK edition, etc.)

I suppose I could overcome this latter issue by just typing in the book title, but barcode scanning is easier ;)

title: Add possibility to chose DESC as sorting option
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="In Beta"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Soon(tm)"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
Can you please let us choose descending as a sort option ?

Especially for the 'Date added' list, this would be useful.

I use this list to see whether I have already added new books I bought, but now, the list is sorted ascending to that 2012 April is displayed before 2012 May and 2012 June.

It would be much more helpful for this list to appear in descending order.

BTW: I really like all the different sorting options, and the fact that you can create your won. Good work.

title: Please ask confirmation when pressing back in the edit screen
label: [Label(name="In Beta")]
body:
Can you please ask a confirmation when you press the 'back' key on the device whilst editing a book entry ?

Now all your entered information is just lost.

It happened several times that when I press 'back' to get rid of the on screen keyboard, I press 'back' twice by accident, which will end the editing action. You are transferred back to the book list and you loose all your entered data.

Especially when you have entered some authors, maybe some series, and some fields, this can be really annoying.

title: Updating list twice if list activity was destroyed
label: [Label(name="Analysis"), Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="On Hold")]
body:
Odd non-critical error, in need of a solution.

Typical flow is:
- go to list
- select book
- make some changes to book
- save
- returns to list
- onActivityResult is called, and list is regenerated

This is fine. But sometimes we have:
- go to list
- select book
- make some changes to book
- somewhere in here, the list activity is destroyed
- save
- returns to list
- onCreate is called, list is generated
- onActivityResult is called, and list is regenerated

We can certainly tell if onCreate is called because another activity just ended, but we can not tell if onActivityResult is going to be called, and neither can we tell if onActivityResult will request a regen (it does not always require a full regen).

This does not cause any breakage, but it doubles the list regen time unnecessarily.

Thoughts:
1. When we call 'startActivityForResult' we could store a flag indicating a result is pending, then check that flag in onCreate (or perhaps check for pending intents?), but this seems like a very fragile solution.
2. We could possibly store a timestamp in 'results' extras; also record the 'lastRegenTime' in the list, and if the result timestamp is before the 'lastRegen' timestamp, skip the regen. But again this seems fragile.
3. This is not a very critical problem, except that it probably affects the phones that would most benefit from it being solved: older slower ones with less memory.

Open to suggestions!

title: Sorting errors for non-numerical series data
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="In Beta"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
This is alluded to in another thread (https://github.com/eleybourn/Book-Catalogue/issues/233), but I figured it deserves its own mention.  

Book Catalogue doesn't sort by series properly when there are non-numerical characters in the series # field (as is OFTEN the case when retrieving series info automatically from Library Thing). Some examples of books like this are in the other thread. 

As mentioned in the other thread, Library Thing sorts by all characters before the "|" symbol and displays only the characters after the "|" symbol. Thus these five books of a series would sort like this:

1
2
3
3.1 | Omnibus 1-3   (displaying only "Omnibus 1-3")
4

Book Catalogue, however, seems to put everything that's not strictly numerical at the end. So it would sort them like this:
1
2
3
4
3.1 | Omnibus 1-3

I don't care so much about what gets displayed, but the Library Thing sorting method is far superior in my opinion, and should be implemented.

body:
Ever since the update to version 4 the lookup list which used to popup when editing the Publisher field has disappeared.

Can you please re-instate this ?

Thanks.

title: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Can not perform this action after onSaveInstanceState
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="On Hold")]
body:
I have requested more info from the user, but received no reply. This looks like a bug in android.

See:
    http://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=19917
and
    http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7575921/illegalstateexception-can-not-perform-this-action-after-onsaveinstancestate-h/9378192#9378192

and has an easy work-around (in code) _if_ we can determine which activity caused it. My money is on 'EditBook' since it is the most likely to use the ViewPager under the hood in ICS.

For now, added and on-hold until we get more reports, or user responds.

title: If the ISBN contains an ending space, the GoodReads synchro fails
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="In Beta")]
body:
I was synchronizing my book collection with GoodReads when I noticed the synchro always stopped at a specific book.

Entering the url displayed in the error message in a browser did display the specific book information.

However, when looking at the book in the BookCatalogue program, I noticed I had by mistake entered a trailing space in the ISBN field.

Removing this space, stopping the background synchro and restarting the synchro fixed the problem.

So , you should trim the ISBN field when syncing with GoodReads.

BTW: very nice additions have been made to the program. Tanks very much, it is highly appreciated here on the other end of the world (Belgium)   :)

title: Merging two authors can cause books to no longer have a 'primary' author or series
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="In Beta")]
body:
Eg. if a book has the following authors:

1: Asimov, I.
2: Asimov, Isaac

and the user edits 'Asimov, I.' to become 'Asimov, Isaac' then we will automatically merge the two authors. Unfortunately when the 'correct' author is the second in the list, this causes the book to end up with the following:

2: Asimov, Isaac

ie. there is no 'primary' author.

The code that does this is CatalogueDBAdapter.globalReplaceAuthor(...) and it needs to have another step added to find all books with _no_ primary author and set the lowest numbered author to be primary (ie. position 1).

Several pieces of code use 'position = 1' as a test, and it would be much slower in SQL to find the lowest numbered author when we build a list.

The same logic also applies to series.

Is anyone else having this problem?

title: Added support for showing search results in the list - when adding a book by name.
body:
Hi, 

I read the issue#221 and I agree that show options when returning a search result (when adding a book by name) can be useful. So I added a checkbox to the name_search screen - if the checkbox is checked, search results will be displayed in the list - if the checkbox isn't checked, only the first book will be returned.

I tried to minimize the necessary changes in the code (and not affect the rest of the application) so the information - whether the search results should be displayed in the list - is appended to the string with author. In the current version, books will be searched only on Amazon and Google Books - but other servers can be added too. Found books are combined through a map, so the result has regular order and duplicates are removed - two books are duplicate if both have the same ISBN or both have the same name and publisher.  

Thanks to the checkbox, the user don't have to use this feature - it's only a option:)

title: Sorting broken in ICS
label: [Label(name="In Beta")]
body:
Using 'Collate UNICODE' as a means of case-insensitive UNICODE-aware sorting does not seem to work in ICS.

It looks like we need to sort by:  

```
lower(field-name) Collate UNICODE 
```

to get the old/correct behaviour. Which adds a fair chunk of time to the queries (about 25%).

Still investigating.

title: Importing from a CSV file...copy images?
label: [Label(name="In Beta")]
body:
As of V4 we will have the ability to import a CSV file from any external bookCatalogue directory, not necessarily just the one in the directory returned by getExternalStorage().

This is good. It means people can upgrade to new phones.

But; those directories may contain images. And they may not be the 'right' bookCatalogue directory.

In the case where the CSV file is not in the 'right' place, my suspicion is that we should do the following:
- if the CSV file has a UUID field, copy any image files we find when we copy the details, unless there is a newer file already present
- if the CSV file does not contain a UUID but it DOES contain an ID, AND there is an id-based file, then when the book is added/updated, we should copy/rename the image if there is not a newer version.

Does this sound right?

title: Additional german translations

Hi Evan,

Daniel

title: Serious issue with getExternalStorage()
label: [Label(name="Analysis"), Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="Feature")]
body:
New phones often have an internal sdcard which is not removable and is returned by getExternalStorage().

Android developers has commented to the effect that getExternalStorage() was badly named and should have been called getSharedStorage().

There is no API for retrieving the actual external device lists.

Further, some manufacturers (Samsung at least) make the internal external storage read-only when mounted on a PC.

The result: those users can not transfer BookCatalogue simply by moving the sdcard.

We are not alone in this: several backup applications have had the same problem.

Any suggestions?

With a new major release coming soon, now might be the right time to get a basic solution in place. I'm not sure I want to write a full-blown file browser, but we need a way to import a csv file that could be in or under /mnt/sdcard, or even in /mnt/sdcard2, or /mnt/ext-sdcard etc etc.

title: Rename all image files in next release?
label: [Label(name="In Beta")]
body:
I've just added a (random) UUID to the books table, which means import/export should no longer be as problematic, especially when importing someone elses export.

The question I have is: can anyone see a readon not to rename all image files to match the UUID of the books?

Disadvantages:
1. May be slow upgrade: rename 1000's of files.
2. Creates a bunch of weird 32 character hex names.
3. Not easy to quickly find the file for a book in a CSV file.

Advantages:
1. Merging collections is easy
2. Overwriting files very unlikely
3. Import/export always safe

When I  go to "Help & Admin" --> "Administration" --> "Export Books" I get a popup window asking "Would you like to send this export as an email." But underneath this popup is a system error, "Export failed - could not write to SDCard." When I attempt to send the export anyway, a mime.822 file is mailed instead.

title: Book-messages...
label: [Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
I've been plugging away at goodreads integration (with a typical export to goodreads running for an hour in the background) and in the process doing a lot of imports and exports to csv files.

This has highlighted to me that we do not have any nice way to present errors from large tasks to users. The preliminary 'Events' list from our background tasks is not exactly friendly.

My suggestion is that we add a 'book_events' table. If a book has an associated book_event, then it gets a little yellow exclamation mark in any book list.

The events should be displayable in book details.

Initially, these would include:
- error while exporting to csv  (currently a Toast message)
- error while importing from csv  (currently a Toast message)
- error sending to goodreads
- error updating from <data-source>

This does not handle complete failure to import a book -- but we could have a parentless event and put a clickable excalamation mark in the top of the main window.

Any thoughts?

Edit: more details---

table events(_id, title, description, created_date)

table book_events (book_id, event_id)

Would just purge events older than 1 week (user pref?)

title: Handling multiple search providers
label: [Label(name="On Hold"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
We currently have:
- google
- amazon
- library thing

and I am adding goodreads.

Searching all 4 concurrently is technically fine, but probably overkill. I am also conscious of the possibility of one or more services disappearing, as well as a user possibly preferrring one site.

As a result, I am considering adding a new 'search provider preferences' activity in which the user can disable some providers and (maybe) choose the preferred order of precedence. Currently we use the precedence: google, amazon, LT....which means we use google data by preference then fill in the blanks from Amazon, and any remaining blanks from LT.

Goodreads will be added before LT because it can search without an ISBN; it also does not seem to unreasonable to me for a user to want goodreads to be the primary source etc.

Which then leads to sources for fields...we currently extract series names from titles at google and amazon, and get series names directly from LT and goodreads.

It _might_ be desirable to say "I only want series from LT" or "I only want series from goodreads".

Any thoughts?
