title: Batch Scanning?
label: [Label(name="Analysis"), Label(name="Feature")]
body:
I know its been raised in user comments, but I could not find an issue. With background processing in place, it becomes easier to handle forground scanning and  background lookups.

The question is, how should it work?

This is how I imaging it working:
- start scanner
- scan a book. 
- If ISBN is valid, make a 'good' beep, add it to queue, return to scanner
- if ISBN is bad, make a "bad" beep, show a toast message, resume scanning
- when user returns from scanner present them with a list of queued books.

The list will show: 
- if found, ISBN, Cover, Title, Author

Clicking on a 'found' item in list will take them to the add screen
Clicking on a 'not found' item will take them to the ISBN entry screen?

The process really breaks down with the "not found" items and with "misfound". How do thy know which physical book was the failure? Or worse, which phsyical book corresponds to the incorrectly found "Mrs Smiths Cookbook for Vegan Dogs"?

This is why I have never been in a hurry to batch scan.  But if anyone out there is passionate about it, now is the time to describe how it whould work!

title: Future(current) bug in main view
label: [Label(name="Analysis"), Label(name="Defect")]
body:
Experimenting with large collections of books has revealed a limit in SQLite that we are likely to experience.

For each group in an ExpandableListView that is expanded, we return a cursor.

If someone clicks 'Expand All', we return 1 cursor for each group.

If that person has somewhere in excess of 800 (not sure exact number) of groups, SQLite will run out of memory/file descriptors/something.

It seems that ExpandableListView keeps thos cursors open for the entire time.

Couple this with the 'fact' (garnered from google) that the memory requirements of an SQLite cursor are not small, and we probably have a problem in the future, or anyone with a large collection now.

[As an aside, we also have a bug where these cursors are not being closed when the BookCatalogue activity is 'stopped'...only when it is destroyed, resulting in excess cursors being kept in memory until a GC]

As someone with about 337 authors, I always scream when I accidentally click 'Expand All' (I can go make a cup of coffee while I wait for it to complete), I have an interest in this area as well.

I am not entirely sure what the best solution is. Some suggestions come to mind:
1. In terms of returning cursors for sub-lists, my suggestion is that we should maybe return array cursors after extracting the data from the cursor ourselves. This may even be memory efficient. Just an array of Parcelables or Bundles might suffice. The onExpandGroup could refresh it (somehow?). Even if the sublist contained 1000 books, this is going to be considerably less than 1MB since it olny needs to contain some IDs and the text required for the related view.
2. The 'expandAll' option shuld probably be removed, or come with a warning. We may even want to auto-collapse groups when another is expanded.

I'd be very interested in any other ideas!

title: Keep resized thumbnails for later use (and store covers in a DB?)
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="In Beta"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
I have a selection of cover images ranging in size from 3k to 1.6MB. Scrolling through a list of books with covers displayed can become very sluggish when it hits one of the larger cover images.

I have experimented with creating permanent resized thumbnail versions if the thumbnail size is less than 10% of the original, and it works well: scrolling is smooth once again.

The problem is that my SD Card is formatted as a FAT file system with a minimum allocation of 32k. This means that while my resized thumbnails have a total size of 883 KILO bytes, they actually consume 18 MEGA bytes of storage.

The same is true for all  downloaded covers: a 4k downloaded cover consumes 32k on the sdcard.

So there are three suggestions: 
1. Build thumbnails for covers whhen the thumbnail is less than 10% of the original.
2. Store the new thumbnails in a DB on the sdcard (or wherever cover images are stored). Or perhaps in the main DB since they are quite small.
3. Consider storing all cover images in the tumbnails database (wherever that may be).

If we went with option (3) as well, we might do well to store some extra data with the covers, including a unique ID, and add cover_id to the books tale (to avoid the export/import problem where covers become mismatched). We might also want to record the original source of the file (URL or camera) as well as the image size and format.

title: List of books as search result
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body: I have has the occasional book that produces very odd search results, and BookCatalogue always chooses the first match. It would be nice to see a list of search results, with the following details: - author - title - isbn - cover and allow choice of the matching book. 95% of the time I will just choose the first book. But 5% of the time it will be a huge bonus. Any thoughts? It might be worth adding other fields: - source (anazon, google, goodreads, librarything) - pages - publisher Post-Implementation: Add: - 'Search for books by same author' - 'Search for books in same series' - 'Search for unowned books by the same author'...ie. do a 'search for books by same author' and filter the results based on your current collection

title: Problem with restoring database
body:
Hello!

I tried searching for help all around but since I didn't find anything related to my specific problem, here goes...

I'm an avid user of BookCatalogue and I recently had some problems with my android phone. Every now and then BookCatalogue prompted me to backup my database to the sdcard, which I did after adding 250 books into the database. Now I had to reinstall the ROM on my phone. I reinstalled book catalogue. How can I restore my books? Which file is the one that counts? I did not EXPORT my book list to a .csv - is that a problem? I tried copying my old BookCatalogue folder (on the SDCARD) over the new one, replacing all files but that didn't help.

Thanks for your time!

Because there are so many editable fields, it is easy to accidentally select a field while attempting to scroll. title: Condense the various four "Add book" options, move sorting, searching, help to first level menu
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body: In an attempt to make the UI a little better and un-bury the sort/search functionality, the four "Add.." options could be combined on the menu and a subsequent "Add by" dialogue could be created. This would free up three spots on the menu (at least on my view of the menu), meaning search, sort, and help/admin could be moved up out of the "More.." menu.

title: Add multiple levels of sorting
label: [Label(name="In Beta"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body: Similar to how many handheld devices allow you to browse music libraries, it would be convenient if we could sort by multiple levels of criteria. Where a music player might allow you to sort by Genre, then Artist, then Album ... I might want to see all of the book series written by one particular author that I have not yet read.This would imply three levels of sorting.

title: Add support for backup/restore to/from dropbox
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
A feature I've found very handy on other applications that need backup functionality is to backup and restore to a user's dropbox account. The application chooses a space within the user's dropbox account to backup to and asks for permission to access the user's dropbox account. Then, it is trivial to share backups between devices. For instance, I find it easier to edit/add books on my tablet .. but I don't take my tablet with me to the book store; I take my phone. Moving things over via email or sd card works, but being able to do it automagically via dropbox would be much more convenient.

For an example of this, see Kuffs Password Safe (or one of the many other password lockers out there on the android market)

title: serious issue with dates in export.csv
label: [Label(name="Defect")]

I just noticed this. I think it's a recent bug, but it's possible it's an older bug I just now noticed:  many of my books do not get their dates exported to the export.csv file. That is, the date shows up when I look at the book in Book Catalogue, but there's just an empty date field in export.csv. 

That's obviously an extremely serious issue because if I go to manually edit some data in export.csv on my computer, when I reimport the data into Book Catalogue, I will lose all of those dates. I've noticed, however, that if I go to one of the books whose date is not exporting (in Book Catalogue), click on the date field, then "set", then "save book", then the next time I export the catalog, the date _does_ show up in the csv file. But I'm not going to do that for hundreds of books.

title: issues with thumbnail pictures "replace from other editions"
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
a) When I go to add/replace a thumbnail cover “from other editions”, often I can see a valid cover, but the program won't let me select it. Two examples of this so you can see what I’m talking about are: Three Hearts and Three Lions, by Poul Anderson, ISBN 9780441808229, the 2nd image present (5th image slot); Ogre, Ogre, by Piers Anthony, ISBN 9780345354921, 1st (only) image present (4th slot).

b) When I go to add/replace a thumbnail cover “from other editions”, sometimes it displays an “!” in the image slots even when an actual cover exists (i.e. when a thumbnail image should be displayed). That is, clicking on some of the “!”s brings up a legit cover that one can select.  I can easily find some examples of this if you are not familiar with this behavior.

title: vibrate on keypress when entering ISBN
body: I've messed up ISBN numbers several times because I thought I pressed a key but it didn't register. In contrast, the calculator program I use does a quick vibration on a keypress. That makes it much easier to enter in numbers because you don’t have to double check that a number actually gets entered--you can just feel it. That would be very helpful to have on the "enter by ISBN" screen.

title: Non-numerical info in series field -- should be allowed
label: [Label(name="In Beta"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
When entering in series info for a book, it should allow non-numerical keys to be used if desired. Non-numerical info gets often added automatically with a lot of the books I enter via ISBN, and I should be able to create my own non-numerical info for books I have to enter manually. 

Here are some specific cases where the non-numerical series info got entered for me automatically; I will hypothesize about why whoever it was entered the series info that way.

---

Book info: Anthony, Piers;  Battle Circle; ISBN 9780380018000

Series_details field: “Battle Circle (100\|Omnibus 1-3)”  (shows up as "100|Omnibus 1-3")

Reason: In this case, the book is a complete series by itself. I suppose the series info is entered that way so that if you have any of the individual series books, too, this one will show up after them.

---

Book info: Cook, Glen; Silver Spike, The; ISBN 9780812502206

Series_details field: “Chronicles of the Black Company (3.5\|spin-off)”  (shows up as "3.5|spin-off")

Reason: This book is sort of part of the Chronicles of the Black Company, but not really. It’s in the same universe and tangentially deals with the main characters. Chronologically it falls between books 3 and 4. Therefore whoever entered the series info listed it as 3.5, but then used some text to write “spin-off” as an explanation.

---

Book info: Karpyshyn, Drew; Path of Destruction; ISBN 9780345477375

Series_details field: “Star Wars (0.010030\|1003-1000 BBY)”  (shows up as “0.010030|1003-1000 BBY”)

Reason: The Star Wars books are sorted by chronological order (in addition to series order), with the chronology being set by DATES, rather than numbers. That way when someone writes a new Star Wars book, one just has to enter in the date the book takes place, and not re-shuffle the chronological info for all of the other books. The dates are given in a “BC” or “AD” kind of fashion, using the codes “BBY” and “ABY”. Thus one must enter text to properly record the date of the book.

---

In addition to letters, all three of those used the symbol “|”. And two used hyphens. None of that is allowed by Book Catalogue.

title: Fix for Issue 214
body:
It seems that Honeycomb releases cursors in Activitiy objects which
have been passed to startManagingObjects() but the underlying users of
those cursors (eg. intrinsic Android adapters) do not expect them to
be deleted.

This patch replaces startManagingCursor() functionality.

Unfortunately Google have not released Android 3.0 source yet, so it
is hard to tell the cause.

Lynne

title: Drop and recreate all indexes on upgrade
label: [Label(name="Defect"), Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
The history of a database seems to determine the collection of indexes present, and it may not reflect the indexes in a clean database.

On the next upgrade (and every time we add/remove/change indexes) we should delete all existing indexes and apply the current indexes.

The query:

select name from sqlite_master where type = 'index' and sql is not null;

will return a list of all index names.

This should probably be done in createIndices().

This becomes a bit tricky, I know, when you want to update serveral fields , but even than, it would be great ( and logical , I think ), to only look up info via the internet when minimum one of the selected fields to update are empty at the moment.
Books which already contain info in all of the selected field, would than be skipped... speeding up the process considerably.

title: Multiple subjects/genres
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Field"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
Google lists I, Robot under:

Fiction / Media Tie-In
Fiction / Science Fiction / General
Fiction / Science Fiction / High Tech
Fiction / Science Fiction / Short Stories
Robots
Science fiction
Science fiction, American
Short stories, American

Amazon has:

Science Fiction
Fiction - Science Fiction
Fiction
Media Tie-In - General
Science Fiction - High Tech
Short stories
Fiction / Science Fiction / General
Science Fiction - General

LibraryThing has:

Feature
Robots › Fiction
Rock music
Science fiction
Science fiction, American

These are pretty varied, and maybe even silly (Rock Music)...but it would be nice to have the same in BookCatalogue.

Prior to doing this we might need a gerealized 'aliases' system to translate, eg, 

'Fiction - Science Fiction' -> 'Fiction / Science Fiction'
and
'Science Fiction - General' -> 'Fiction / Science Fiction / General'

etc. Perhaps based on some advice from a person who knows more about libraries than I!

title: Some more stuff...
body:
Given this included debug-only code (mostly disabled) I was not sure if I should merge it or not...
1. Fixed index creation code to loop through statements
2. \- Use two cursors rather than fetchBookByISBNOrCombo; faster on 
    big import.
   - Removed CatalogueDBAdapter.fetchBookByISBNOrCombo (no longer
     used)
   - Added CatalogueDBAdapter.fetchByAuthorAndTitle
3. \- Left some (mostly commented out) debugging code for copying
    actual database file.
   - Added CatalogueDBAdapter.backupDbFile for debugging purposes

title: Bug-ette in creating indexes...
label: [Label(name="Defect")]

title: For discussion: custom fields
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
There have  been a few requests for new fields:
- Date loaned
- Date to return
- Language
- Date purchased
- Maxi series
- No of copies

Some of these really foreshadowed improved features eg. Loan and return stuff could be enhanced and # of copies presupposes a solution to duplicate management.

But I wonder if there is any value in considering allowing the user to add fields at runtime. They would need to be limited to certain types etc...but is it worth pursuing as an idea?

title: For discussion: Book Details view?
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
I am wondering if there _may_ be a place for a 'book details' view much like the editing view, but which merely displays the book. The things that made me consider this were:
- in the 'Edit Book' window it would be nice to use 'back' and 'forward' (left/right) gestures to go to the next book (without editing the book details and clicking 'save' or 'cancel').
- it would be great to scan an ISBN and go to the 'book details' screen (if present)

Once on the 'book details' screen, I would envisage the 'Menu' button should bring up a menu with the following functions:
- edit book (go to traditional editor)
- lend/return book
- delete book

Not sure what other functions would be useful. Any atomic operation on a book would be a candidat - eg. changing the cover, changing the rating, marking as 'Read'/'Not Read' etc.

In any case, I'd be interested in thoughts (especially those of the original author!)

title: For discussion: Duplicate books
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="Request")]
body:
I have several books with more than one copy, but the same ISBN. There seem to be two solutions to this:
- the 'inventory management' solution -- have a '# of copies' field
- the 'library' solution -- list them both in the library catalogue

The former is probably easier, but the 'library' solution is probably better becuase it allows tracking of distinct books (eg. lending both out to different people). So I am leaning towards the latter.

My thinking is:
- display a warning before adding a duplicate book.
- add it as a new book if the user chooses.

...and problem solved...I think.

Can anyone see a problem with this technically (eg. is uniqueness of ISBNs assumed in the app -- I dont think so) or from a user perspective?

title: Allow multiple backup files - and make it different from the export function
body:
I noticed just now that the export and the backup option all write the csv data to the 'export.csv' file.

Would it not be more logical to separate these 2 ? 

E.g. create an 'export.csv' if the user manually chooses this option , and create an 'backup.csv' with the backup option ? I for one, being a programmer myself, always choose to separate user actions from system actions. The export is selected by the user, for whatever reason, the backup option is 'forced' by the system ( forced is too strong a word here, I know, but you know what I mean).

I would also like to suggest keeping several copies (3 or more) of the backup.csv. If something goes wrong for whatever reason, it's always nice to be able to go back one of two 'versions' .

title: Please add an option to sort by title without showing the thumbmail
body:
Hi Evan,

I was in a second hand bookshop during the weekend, where they some second hand Star Trek books.
Having my Star Trek book list with me (thanks to Android and your program :)  ), I decided to test how easy it is to find books which I did not already have.

In the odd chance that I have misplaced a book in the wrong bookshelf, I decided that the best way to do this, was to use 'All books' as bookshelf and to sort the list on title (authors sometimes are wrong certainly for anthologies).

Howeveer, since by book list is already about 600 books , it really takes some time for your program to build the complete list.

What's more , in the end , for the purpose I needed it , I really don't need the thumbs (which , I can image , slows down the build program quit a bit, no ).

So I would like to propose a sort by title <no thumbs>  option.

And as a second enhancement for this action : I would like to propose a division by first character ... just as when you do when sorting series. This would greatly easy the finding of a title since I could very quickly jump to a certain character.

In stead the very first booshelf is assigned to the new book.

I can't put my finger on it, yet , but it might have something to do when entering a wrong ISBN number. Your program reports that it can't find the book. You press 'return' and use the option 'add via ISBN' again to add the corrected ISBN number.

It also might have something to when putting your phone in landscape while entering a book.

As I said, no big deal . If I can get you a definitive scenario, I will, but if you look at the code, you might want to verify the assignmend of the bookshelf.

title: export file format not consistent with file type
body:
Export function now generates a tab delimited file, but identifies it as csv.  This confuses some spreadsheet programs, which look for comma delimiters in csv files.  Workaround is to rename the export file to a .txt file before opening it with the spreadsheet.  Reverse the process to write from the spreadsheet in tab delimited .txt and rename to .csv to read into program on phone.

Quotes are required around strings that contain commas to avoid problems.  Here are a couple of example lines that were written by Excel 2000 in portable formats.

CSV format:
4,Gladwell,Malcolm,4,Outliers,9780316017923,"Little, Brown and Co.",11/18/2008,0,1,Default,0,,,309,,,0,,,,0,0,null,
11,Goldwag,Arthur,11,"Cults, Conspiracies, and Secret Societies",9780307390677,"Random House, Inc.",8/11/2009,0,1,Default,0,Vintage,,370,,,0,,,,0,0,null,

Tab delimited text format (.txt):
4   Gladwell    Malcolm 4   Outliers    9780316017923   "Little, Brown and Co." 11/18/2008  0   1   Default 0           309         0               0   0   null  
11  Goldwag Arthur  11  "Cults, Conspiracies, and Secret Societies" 9780307390677   "Random House, Inc."    8/11/2009   0   1   Default 0   Vintage     370         0               0   0   null

title: Upgrade of Android to HTC Desire causes a hang when searching for books
body:
Evan,

yes mate, this does "duplicate" 95 - closed it without realising what I was doing! Half asleep! Sorry.

Having upgraded my HTC Desire to include the recent patch to implement Flash Player, any attempt to search for a book results in Book Catalogue hanging - either when the ISBN is scanned or when it is typed in. May be coincidental to the HTC upgrade, may be a clash with other s/ware, Just noticed it today, having upgraded the kernel.

I can still enter books manually - just don't try to retieve from the internet.

I thought at first that the problem was that Advanced Task Killer was killing off parts of the app - turns out that even with ATK uninstalled, the problem returns.

I've now tried scanning a brand new book, and it has given me the message "ISBN Scanned. Searching Internet" after being left for about three to four minutes. After another minute or two, the screen responds, filled in.

Am I missing the obvious? Is it just that Amazon in running REALLY slow?

Having said that, it runs perfectly when the handset starts up, then slows dramatically within about 30 seconds to this "snail's pace", so I still do think it is something to do with the OS or the app in combination with something else.

Regards, Roy

title: Thumbnails in list view (optional)
body:
Would be good to be able to see the thumbnails for books in the list view, and to be able to turn this on and off... 

Not sure yet if you can select books by genre, but this would be useful too.

title: Bulk move of books to Bookshelf
label: [Label(name="Wishlist")]
body: Would like to be able to select multiple books and move to a Bookshelf together (say I had 20 books on a shelf, scan all the barcodes, do the amazon search, populate the fields, then select all books at once and move to existing bookshelf (e.g. Lounge Top Shelf).

title: Bulk import of ISBNs
label: [Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body: Have an existing catalogue (Readerware) and would like to export this and import it to Book-Catalogue.. If necessary via ISBNs only (can refill bookshelf/location field at later date).

title: Problem on Evo:  When entering price cannot use decimal.
body: When ebetering price (Evo) cannot use the decimal.  Example.  Cannot enter list price like 18.95.  There is no response from the decimal keypress.  So have to enter as 1895.

title: Refresh bookshelves when changed
body:
When I add a new bookshelf, I can't see it as a sorting option on the first page until after I fully close and re-open the application.
Example: I add the shelf "Manga" and put some books on the shelf. I tap the bar at the top to change the bookshelf, and the only options are "all books" and "default."

Via email from Julia

title: Add hide thumbnails in the field visibility list
body: Via email from Martin

title: Automatically search for and populate any blank fields
body: Have a list of fields (checkboxes) that the user can search/populate

title: Thumbs don't appear when sorting by series
Rotate thumbnail option
body: It should also save vertical by default

title: On anthology edit, scroll to edited title
Remove extraneous punctuation from anthology automation
Anthology titles / authors should be camel case
Changing the Anthology Status should update the tabs at the top of the screen
There are list display errors in 1.6
body: setTextView does not seem to be a valid method

title: Crop photographed covers
label: [Label(name="Wishlist")]
body: So difficult. To come back to soon.

title: Export the anthology titles correctly
body: They do not export at the moment

title: There is a SQLite database leak
body:
Close the database cursor when appropriate.
- http://stackoverflow.com/questions/2280345/sqlite-database-leak-found-exception-in-android
- http://www.coderanch.com/t/454535/Android/Mobile/Leak-Found-Exception

title: Make links in about page blue
Add Audiobook field
body:
Abridged / Unabridged

Via Email from Ted

title: Import / Export on the HTC Desire
body:
Hey Evan,

I may be missing something, but on the HTC Desire, the file is expoirted as tab delimited, rather than "true" CSV, and any attempt to edit or add a record causes the Book Catalogue to crash when the edited or new record is opened. I'm editing the file using Open Office, and cannot see anything wrong with the file in Open Office Calc. Am I missing something?

Otherwise, absolute best "book bag" software I've found on Android!

title: Create a subject field
body:
Populated automatically.

Via email from Tosh

title: Create a version of the book catalogue for CD's and DVD's
label: [Label(name="Feature"), Label(name="On Hold"), Label(name="Request")]
body: Requested via email by Robert

title: search via LCCCN
label: [Label(name="Request"), Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
can you add Library of Congress Catilogue Card Numbers (LCCCN) to the search perameters?  People who collect historical books would probably appreciate this.

Via email from karen

title: the default bookshelf for a new entry should be the current bookshelf
body:
when I enter a new book the bookshelf assigned to that book by default seems always to be my first bookshelf alphabetically.  In my case, this is 'Art'.  
When you're doing mass entries this is a real pain.  I think that the default bookshelf for a new entry should be the current bookshelf.  That way you can select a bookshelf first and all your new entries will assigned that bookshelf.  That would cut down a lot on tapping and scrolling for bookshelf selection, especially during mass entries. 

via email from Martin

title: Suggestion:  Default to "All" rather than "Default".
body: Maybe there's a way to do this already and I just did not see it.  But I have no books under "Default".  All are categorized.  So every time I open the app I have to change the list to "All" or a particular category to see any books.  Would be nice if the list defaulted to "All" or optionally we could choose what category to default to.

title: Suggestion:  Add (optional?) tab with larger thumbnail.
label: [Label(name="Wishlist")]
body: The thumbnails are very tiny.  It would be great if there was a tab for each book with a larger cover picture.  I realize this might also need to be optional for folks with low space phones.  So maybe have a checkbox in the admin area to enable or diable just a tab?

title: Allow users to delete thumbnails
body: By hold clicking on the thumbnail

title: Create a "location" field
body:
To store which location a book is in. Similar to bookshelf. 

Via email from Cam

title: Allows users to turn fields on or off as required
body: So as to not clutter up the screen too much.

title: Create Help Section
body:
Rename admin to Help and administration. 

Help should display for every section.

title: Add a read date started and finished
body:
Hello, I currently use your apparently and find it very useful.  Would it be at all possible to add a read date started and finished.  Thank you for your consideration

Via email from Robert

title: Book Wish List
body:
it would be a great help if you could add a wish list so that we can keep track of the books we plan on getting

Via email from Beth

title: Books in multiple bookshelves
body:
This is probably a tough request, but it would be great if books could appear in more than one bookshelf.  With a flat file database, I guess you’d have to set a limit – say 5.  Big change though.

Via email from Mike & Ted

title: Unicode in export
body:
One of the authors names had a problem with a foreign character in the exported file, but that’s definitely my problem.  I fixed it with Unicode (wish I could figure out how to make it the default, but that’s not your issue).

Via email from Mike

title: Export date incorrect
body:
One of the books I tried with has a different format and incorrect date in the exported file – 1992-0-1, but it looks fine in the application (Jan 01 1992).

Via email from Mike

title: Improve bookshelf change interface
body:
It took me a while to figure out how to change the bookshelf.  I know the press and hold method is common, but I couldn’t figure out where to press.  It would be great to have the default bookshelf be sticky.

via Email from Mike

title: Google Books Offline
body:
Last Thursday or Friday, I was using your program catalogue some books, successfully, when I started getting info popups that said it couldn't connect with google books.

I've tried acouple of times a day since then without success, and getting the same error.

Other google or net items work fine.

Via email from Martin

title: Has a bug in export. All months are exported 1 lower than it should. Jan = 0 Feb = 1 instead of 1 and 2.
body: Via Comment from Charley

To use in conjunction or replace of isbn or barcode searching

body:
Primary reason for me is to use it as a loan tracker.
It would be nice to see who has loaned what book(s)

title: Add a list all loaned books option.
Extend save state functionality

to include bookshelf and position details

title: Add icons to the admin tabs
Save sort option and display that way when loading
body:
It's "author-centric" instead of "title-centric" and doesn't save it's state,
so every time I open it, I have to change from "All books" to the particular bookshelf I want,
then I want to see titles, so I have to do a Sort by Title... a bit of a pita to do every time. 

Via email from Martin

body:
Also, it would be helpful to have an 'About' page with working links to your homepage and email

Via Email from Martin

body: Take a snapshot of the book and save it to the bookCatalogue folder

Instead of Book Catalogue (edit book) it should be

Book Catalogue (Foundation and Empire)

title: Crashes on Droid Eris
body: The force close occurred with 3 books, Broken Wings by V.C Andrews, Hawksong and Snakecharm by Amelia Atwater-Rhodes. I hope you can resolve this. The Book Catalogue is really the best on the market. (via email from Mary)

title: SQLiteException in com.eleybourn.bookcatalogue
body:
android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: near "(": syntax error: , while compiling: SELECT b._id, a.family_name || ', ' || a.given_names as author, b.title, b.isbn, b.publisher, b.date_published, b.rating, bs.bookshelf, b.read, b.series, b.pages, b.series_num FROM books b, bookshelf bs, authors a WHERE bs._id=b.bookshelf AND a._id=b.author AND b.isbn=6722610 (Library of Congress Catalog Card No.) ORDER BY lower(b.title)

android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: near "engle": syntax error: , while compiling: SELECT _id, family_name, given_names FROM authors WHERE family_name='L'engle' AND given_names='Madeleine'

android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: near "s": syntax error: , while compiling: SELECT _id, bookshelf FROM bookshelf WHERE bookshelf='Wade's books'

android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: near "Connor": syntax error: , while compiling: SELECT _id, family_name, given_names FROM authors WHERE family_name='O'Connor' AND given_names='Jane'

title: Goto edit through a book view page
body: going straight to edit when selecting a book from the bookshelf is annoying. A display of the books details with a larger cover image would be great. (Raised via email from Colin)

title: Flag duplicates when they're first scanned
body: flag duplicates when they're first scanned. Don't wait until they're saved. (Raised via email from Colin)

That displays on update. 

Maybe add it to the database upgrade method.

title: Create a tabbed book edit interface
body:
Tab 1: Edit
Tab 2: Description / Notes
Tab 3: Loaned (see task #27) / ?

From the list, a single click should take you to Tab 1. Hold+Click should bring up a menu which allows you to jump to Tab 2 or 3.

title: Crashes on Motorola Droid - Reported Bug
body: I have the Motorola Driod. I love your app. The only issue I have is I get a force close message everytime I try to add books by barcode. I didn't know if something was wrong with the phone or the app. If fixed it would definitely be one of my top ten favorite apps.

Seach by ISBN first, then by author + title

body: The current thumb is way too small.

title: Add support for anthologies
body: So a single book (with an editor) can list all the titles / authors within it

title: After creating a book, it should automatically scroll to that author/title
Export / Import capability
body:
Export to CSV format. This should save onto the SD Card at this stage. Further options to email the export can come later. 

The system should be able to import from the same format. Modified rows (identified with the same book Id) should be updated automatically. New rows (without a book id) should be added. 

After importing, the export should be run again, to ensure new rows are given the appropriate id's.

title: Search suggestions
label: [Label(name="Wishlist")]
body:
There should be an suggestion dropdown when typing in the search box

Similar to the suggestion dropdown in the author or title fields when editing a book. However the dropdown should contains words from all searchable fields.

title: Make the search results page obvious
body: It is not obvious you are on the search results page

title: Remember expandable list state when deleting book (or going back)
body:
e.g. You have expanded "Isaac Asimov", select "Foundation" from the list of 10 books. Edited the book and saved, or just hit the back button. 

Isaac Asimov will be collapsed when you go back.

It should remain open when you go back.
